Camera used: Sony Cybershot F-750 Geo. location: Trust, NC Judge's comments: I do like the "contrast" between yellow and green, and the brown mule stands out well. An effective photo, congrats!

Photo of the Day for June 21, 2003 -- Bumble Bee in B&W urlLink Photographer: Cheryl Meisel Comments: Another shot of a bumble bee in my garden. I am in love with him. :) Camera used: Sony 707 Geo. location: Erie, MI Judge's comments: I've liked your bee photos in the past, but this one has great DOF and the black & white is quite unexpected for a bee photograph. Well done!

Photo of the Day for June 20, 2003 -- Underneath the Arches urlLink Photographer: Bob Patterson Comments: A view of a local river boat called a "gabare" as it prepared to pass through one of the arches of the main bridge over the River Dordogne at Bergerac in Southern France. The boats were originally designed for moving bulk cargoes via the river but are now used almost exclusively as pleasure cruisers. Camera used: Fuji 6800Z Geo. location: Bergerac, France Judge's comments: Great photo and a nice composition. The almost perfect reflection of the arches makes this a masterpiece. Reminder! Only ten days left to participate in the urlLink Shutterline Cash Contest for this month. Check it out today and purchase a few submission credits, if you haven't done so already.

Photo of the Day for June 19, 2003 -- Little is Better urlLink Photographer: Kaye Grogan Comments: This picture was taken in the rural area just outside Rocky Mount, Virginia. I love how the little barn is still very "overpowering" in this picture. Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: I agree, it's a powerful composition -- nice work. This would make a great enlargement or poster image! Hey! If you've been viewing the Photo of the Day and wish to participate in the contest yourself, just become a member. urlLink Click here to sign up within two minutes. By joining our site, you also provide the revenue necessary to keep the POTD going without pesky advertisements.

Photo of the Day for June 18, 2003 -- Sunset Geese urlLink Photographer: Mary Ann Melton Comments: This picture was taken along the Mississippi River in November along the Illinois shore. The sun pillar was so beautiful that night. Being from Texas we had never seen one before. The flying geese provided one of our best pictures that night. Camera used: Olympus 200Z, D510Z Geo. location: Illinois Judge's comments: An interesting sunset photo, great colors and I have never seen a "pillar" before.

Photo of the Day for June 17, 2003 -- Seeger Park urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Well I went to another of my lofts, top levels of parking garages. I like the views I can get from them and have tried about 4 or 5, each with no problem. I would was just going to try some more city scapes from this venue but it was just past dusk and Seeger Park had some activity going on. I did panorama version of the scenes in the park with a back drop of the city as seen from the edge of South Philadelphia. There are 6 shots stitched together in Pano Stitcher by Pixtra and post processed in Photo Shop Elements. Camera used: Fuji FP S602 Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: An excellent urban panorama, I especially like the glow of the street lights with the skyscrapers in the background.
Photo of the Day for June 16, 2003 -- Bzzzzz urlLink Photographer: Mariette Geest Camera used: Fuji S2 Judge's comments: Interesting macro with a great depth of field. Nice work.

Photo of the Day for June 15, 2003 -- Bumper Crop urlLink Photographer: Glenn Jensen Comments: This is the Cadillac Ranch you may or may not have heard about. During the 1970's, an artist group had these ten 40's - 60's era cadillacs placed vertically in the ground on a farm outside of Amarillo as a tribute to the Cadillac tailfin and old Route 66 in general. Supposedly, they lean at the same angle as the sides of the Great Pyramids, and visitors are encouraged to add their own artwork via spraypaint. This shot was taken on Sunday afternoon in June, 2003, a few hours following a rainshower. Camera Settings: f/8, 1/800 s, ISO 100 Camera used: Sony DSC-F707 + 0.7x wide-angle conversion lens Geo. location: Amarillo, TX Judge's comments: Very unique photograph, thanks for submitting it! I guess it's the equivalent of Stone Henge in Texas... Thanks also for the camera settings.

Photo of the Day for June 28, 2003 -- Patiently Waiting urlLink Photographer: Doug Mauck Comments: An old man, probably waiting for an old woman to finish shopping on the Island of Crete in the Greek Islands. Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: Crete Judge's comments: Excellent shot, it's been a while since Shutterline has seen a good candid like this one. Congrats on the win!

Needless to say, you'll only see advertisements from reputable companies. If the company isn't offering a genuinely useful serivce, it isn't allowed to advertise here. Right now, you'll see ads for two of America's least expensive ISPs. I feel this is useful to members because surely some of you must be unhappy with unreliable or slow Internet connections. With limited advertising like this at Shutterline, we'll (hopefully) gain the cashflow necessary to award POTW winners cash prizes on a more regular basis.

Photo of the Day for June 27, 2003 -- Soft Landing urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: A young Snowy Egret glides in for a landing at the Alligator Farm. Photo taken June 24, 2003. Camera used: Canon EOS 10D w/Canon 100-400mm lens Geo. location: St. Augustine, Florida Judge's comments: A great photo from Shutterline's birdman! Excellent framing with the wings reaching from edge to edge.

Photo of the Day for June 26, 2003 -- Brownie urlLink Photographer: Cheryl Meisel Comments: A butterfly feeding. Camera used: Sony 707 Geo. location: Erie, MI Judge's comments: This is a fantastic butterfly macro. I'm not big on insects, but the rich colors and perfect DOF make this a real winner. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for June 25, 2003 -- Bad Hair Day urlLink Photographer: Lesley Mattuchio Comments: I attended an AKC Agility Trial last weekend and had some genuine fun photographing the dogs. Camera used: Canon 10D Geo. location: Topsfield, MA Judge's comments: Great action capture! Good DOF and an impressive shot overall.

Photo of the Day for June 24, 2003 -- An Abstract Reflection of Clouds urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Back to my one of my favorite reflective buildings, Logan Two! It was sunny that day, well actually partially cloudy (not to be confused with partially sunny which is only used on weekends and holidays! LOL!). The sun got behind some of the clouds and made the reflection quite interesting. Camera used: Fuji FP 2800 Geo. location: Philadelphia Judge's comments: Great symmetry and cloud reflections, I really like this city shot.

Photo of the Day for June 23, 2003 -- A Close Shave urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Comments: Well ... what can I say? I sharpened all my pencils :) Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: A unique and colorful still-life composition, congrats!

Photo of the Day for June 22, 2003 -- Douc Langur urlLink Photographer: J. Pedersen Comments: I know Cheryl hates monkeys but these are the most beautiful creatures. They are from Vietnam. Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: Vietnam Judge's comments: Great monkey portrait lol! It certainly has a pensive look on its furry face.

Photo of the Day for July 5, 2003 -- Wherever it may lead... urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Comments: I originally took this shot last year with the intention of converting to black & white, but in the end I liked sepia better, I like how it brings out the texture of the wood but still enhances that warm sunny feeling that you get from the spots of sunlight on the path. Camera used: Canon PS Pro90 IS Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: I know you submitted this shot a while ago, but I really like it. Great framing and the sepia setting really does make this photo.

Photo of the Day for July 4, 2003 -- Happy 4th! urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Well you see they had these Fuji Spider Mums at the shops of Liberty Place. I thought my Fuji might like them. Happy 4th of July! Rob Camera used: Fuji FP S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Happy 4th of July to all of our U.S. visitors, and a belated happy Canada Day to our Canadian members and visitors. Hmm... if any of you international visitors have an independence day coming up soon, urlLink contact us and we'll mention it. :)

Photo of the Day for July 3, 2003 -- Sunset at the Canyon urlLink Photographer: J. Pedersen Camera used: Sony DSC F505 Geo. location: The Grand Canyon Judge's comments: Great red colors and an exciting landscape. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for July 2, 2003 -- Curly urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Comments: Playing around some more with my pencil shavings... Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: A simple, but creative macro shot. The bright green and the shadow really make this photo unique in its own strange way.

Photo of the Day for July 1, 2003 -- For 800 Years urlLink Photographer: Chris Crosby Comments: Black and White of Notre Dame shot from under a stone bridge across the Seine River. Shot with Canon S40 in black and white mode. Minor cropping and color adjustment in Photoshop. Camera used: Canon S40 Geo. location: Paris, France Judge's comments: A great first-time win [I believe] for Chris here at Shutterline. An interesting and moody black&white composition! By the way, Chris, next time you submit please reduce the image size a bit. I was forced to resize the image so that slow Internet users won't have to wait for the image to load. A couple of other comments. The urlLink Shutterline Cash Contest for June has ended and we've posted the winning photo there. We also have a new contest running for July/August that promises to be just as fun (and it will probably have a larger cash prize this time). And finally, feel free to patronize the advertisers shown on the top of the POTD pages. They help us pay our bills now, which is always nice.

Photo of the Day for June 30, 2003 -- Genie in the Sky urlLink Photographer: Kay Prather Comments: After a rainy day, the sun came out and with it some beautiful clouds and a beauty of a sunset. I watched in awe as the cloud formation formed this genie in the sky. Was awesome and beautiful Camera used: Nikon CoolPix 995 Geo. location: South, La Judge's comments: A beautiful sunset with great reflections in the water. Congrats on your win!

Photo of the Day for June 29, 2003 -- Drink Squirt! urlLink Photographer: Ron Case Comments: This is an old advertisement painted on the side of a long-abandoned general merchandise store in a small town in central Utah. We passed this building while on a weekend trip and I turned around to take some pictures. I remember seeing this cartoon character as a child and in drinking Squirt. I don't know if Squirt is still available - I haven't seen it anywhere for many years. Outside the picture is the price of a bottle of this soda - a nickel. Unfortunately I couldn't work the price into the composition. Camera used: Kodak DC3400 Geo. location: Wellsville UT Judge's comments: A good, unique composition. The bricks make the texture interesting as well. In other news, today is the last full day to urlLink participate in the June Cash Contest.

Photo of the Day for July 12, 2003 -- Show-Off urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: I was very pleased with the body curve as well as "facial expression" of this flying Bottlenose Dolphin that I shot at Marineland. Photo taken July 11, 2003 using my Canon 100-400mm lens. Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: Marineland, Florida Judge's comments: Show-off, indeed! I don't know about the facial expression there, but it very well might be a smile of some sort. Great photo, as always, Jim. T A L E N T S E A R C H Do you have what it takes to pursue a fun, active, and challenging career in the exciting and high-tech field of Photo of the Day judging? Do you work well with people? Are you an excellent photographer? Just kidding about all that, but I really am searching for a POTD judge to take over for the next 3 months effective as soon as possible. I've enjoyed judging all of your photos, but months ago (at the beginning of 2003, right?) we all collectively agreed that members should get a shot at judging the photos here. Cheryl was a great POTD judge for well over a year, Bob did a great job during his 3 months or so, and I've been filling in for a while. Time to step up to the plate. If you're interested, please urlLink contact me . Premium Members only, please. Also, if you ask to be judge you need to be able to login each day and select/post the winning photo. If your life is too busy to work this into your schedule, please don't ask to be the judge. Thousands of people *rely* on you each day to pick a cool photo and brighten their day.

Photo of the Day for July 11, 2003 -- Icy Wind and Waves urlLink Photographer: Drake Olmstead Comments: Taken in South Haven Michigan this past December. It was very cold, with big waves! Camera used: urlLink Nikon D100 Geo. location: South Haven, MI Judge's comments: A great winter photo composition, refreshing to see it (especially considering how hot it has been around the U.S. lately). Congratulations on your first win at Shutterline! Also, in every submission please include the camera used to take the shot. I'm assuming you used your D100, but some Shutterliners use multiple cameras so we ask that the camera be mentioned in every submission. Thanks.

Photo of the Day for July 10, 2003 -- Blue Hue urlLink Photographer: Margaret Schmidt Camera used: Canon 10D Judge's comments: Colorful flower composition with good DOF. Congrats, but no comments on this photo?

Photo of the Day for July 9, 2003 -- Hood Ornament urlLink Photographer: Ron Case Comments: This is an extreme close-up of the hood ornament from a 1949 Cadillac. It was taken at a classic car show held over the July 4th weekend. I added a +7 close-up lens to my camera (which screws onto the camera lens) and shot in macro mode. When you shoot in macro mode with my camera, the focusing system is disabled and you have to physically move the camera in and out to focus on your subject. To future complicate matters, the +7 adapter gives an extremely narrow depth of field. Camera used: urlLink Kodak DC3400 Geo. location: Wellsville, UT Judge's comments: An extremely unique and interesting still-life macro composition. Thanks for submitting it!

Photo of the Day for July 8, 2003 -- Fallow Deer urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: none Camera used: urlLink Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City, TX Judge's comments: I really like this crisp photograph, and the contrast between the colorful deer and the bland background. On another note, feedback on the larger thumbnails here has been positive -- so for now I think we'll adopt the larger thumbnail system. Also, until Friday we have a huge sale on new Shutterline urlLink memberships . It's worth checking out if you've been thinking about joining the site for a while.

Photo of the Day for July 7, 2003 -- Delaware River Front Fireworks urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: This is a composite of two separate shots taken on the same night. I took over a 100 shots of the Two Cities, Two States Fireworks Extravaganza. On my way home a tried a new parking garage to get some night shots of the river front. I took the base photo there. I added a firework shot to it in PS elements. Camera used: Fuji FP S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Great composition, and thanks for explaining the edits you made. Also, I decided to make the thumbnails bigger for now. Does everyone like this idea? urlLink Let me know.

Photo of the Day for July 6, 2003 -- Crane in B&W urlLink Photographer: J. Pedersen Comments: African Crowned Crane. One of my favorite birds, they are very beautiful. Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: not provided! Judge's comments: Great black & white profile of a beautiful bird, congrats!

Photos of the Day for July 19, 2003 Other -- Old Warrior urlLink Photographer: Lyn Winans Camera used: Olympus E20 Geo. location: Minden,ON,Canada Judge's comments: I really had to look well and am still wondering whow big this machine is in reality. I think it is a very well chosen angle to shoot from. Excellent detail and colors this way. Congrats Lyn! Scenic -- Golden Sunset urlLink Photographer: Drake Olmstead Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Grand Haven, Michigan - of Lake Michigan. Judge's comments: A great sunset and indeed a golden one. I like the diagonal lines and the silhouettes. Very good exposure and very attractive picture. Congrats Drake.

Photos of the Day for July 18, 2003 Animals -- Bird's Eye View urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: I was shooting Pelicans when this Seagull flew over and dropped his catch at my feet. He was hovering here wanting to come in and pick it back up before I got it. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City, Texas Judge's comments: Another great bird shot by Bob. I like the detail and expression of the bird. I wonder why you did not pick up his catch :-) Congrats on the gull picture Bob. Macro -- " Lily In The Light " urlLink Photographer: Lesley Mattuchio Comments: I love to garden and in the summertime I am glued to my backyard trying to capture my flowers in every possible light and position. I like how this photo of one of my Asiatic Lilies looked with the lighting of the moment and the way the shadows fell so I got creative with it. Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: Melrose, MA. USA Judge's comments: This Lily looks great although I must say that I think that the original - non edited version - would be good as well. But I can imagine very well how the shadows fell over this Lily and I like the editing work very much since it points out the shadows well. Congrats Lesley.

Photos of the Day for July 17, 2003 Other -- "Mirror Reflection" urlLink Photographer: Cheryl Tessens Comments: I finally made it downtown to the weekly alley car cruise. As I was walking around and looking at first I spied a tire eflection.Then as I was setting myself up to take this shot I was surprised to see more.Instead I saw the entire car parked alongside this big black cadillac reflected back at me. I had some difficulty getting this shot as the sun was shining in such a way that it was refracting off my lense causing sun spots to appear everywhere.I found an open doorway which offered my lense some protection from the rays of the sun which allowed me to capture this shot. Of all the shots that I took yesterday I think this one is the best of them all. Camera used: Nikon CP 4500 Geo. location: Holly MI Judge's comments: I had to look what I saw exactly and then it made me smile. An old car and a modern one reflected. I know that it is difficult to shoot something like this in the bright sun and I think you did an excellent job, especially with the 'old and new accent'. Congratulations Cheryl. Animals -- Jellyfish urlLink Photographer: Margaret Satchell Comments: Jellyfish exhibited in the Boston aquarium. When I saw the photo on my computer screen I thought it looked oddly atmospheric, like outer space. Camera used: Olympus c4040 Geo. location: Boston Judge's comments: I think this is a great capture of a jellyfish. Lighting in an aquarium is not easy at all! Congrats with this jelly shot Margaret!

Photos of the Day for July 16, 2003 Macro -- Amazing Green urlLink Photographer: Mary Ann Melton Comments: This picture was taken in my yard in some tall grass in a corner. It amazes me the number of varieties of grasshoppers that live here. This one is such a pretty green. I underexposed this picture to make the grasshopper stand out and to make the background more distinctive. Camera used: Canon EOS D60 Geo. location: Garden Judge's comments: The green of the leaves and the green of the grasshopper is really attractive. Please click on the original since the thumbnail does not show the quality of the picture. The composition is great and the detail of the animal too. Congrats Mary Ann Scenic -- Ubehebe Crater urlLink Photographer: J. Pedersen Comments: This was taken in Death Valley, California during our May 2003 vacation. The wind was blowing so hard I felt like I was going to sail right into the crater. Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: Death Valley Judge's comments: A good shot of a great location in Death Valley. I think the depth of the crater is very well captured. Congrats Janet.

Congratulations to Drake Olmstead for winning the Photo of the Week. His photograph is now featured on the Shutterline.com homepage for literally thousands of visitors to view each day. Additionally, he is entitled to receive a free Gift Membership (a $25 value) to give to a friend or family member so that they can participate here as well. Special thanks to our urlLink sponsor for making the Gift Membership prize possible. As our traffic continues to increase on a daily basis (thank you USA Today ), we will be able to secure larger sponsorships -- and thus cooler prizes for our Photo of the Week winners. Now's probably a great time to join Shutterline. Mariette should have your Photo of the Day up shortly. Enjoy, and please spread the word about the Photo of the Day. Thousands of students and bored office execs click onto the Photo of the Day every morning to view the winners.

Photo of the Day for July 15, 2003 Animals -- "Allure of The Green Mamba" urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: Taken with my Canon 50mm 2.5 lens on July 14, 2003 at the Jacksonville Zoo. While I do not like snakes at ALL, I do find myself drawn to photographing them every chance I get...especially the more deadly ones, and the Green Mamba is right up there in that category....weird, eh? :^) Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: Jacksonville, Florida Judge's comments: Another great 'Jim Carper' shot. I did not know untill I looked at the names. What a stunning picture. I am actually afraid of snakes but the snake on the picture is worthwhile looking at without having to be afraid ;-) I really like the composition of the picture and the idea of movement. It feels as if the snake is coming at you while he keeps an eye on you! Great color and detail as well. Congrats Jim!

Photo of the Day for July 14, 2003 Scenic -- Clouds and Lines urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Out at lunch on July 1st. Great cloud day. These are reflected in the Mellon Bank Building. Camera used: Fuji FP S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: I like the geometric lines and the clouds that are being reflected. Also the color of the picture is very attractive and reflects the idea of the sky pretty well. This will be my first day and I sincerely hope I will do a good job. Anyway, I will do my best

Photo of the Day (C Series) for July 13, 2003 -- Sunset at the Shore urlLink Photographer: J. Pedersen Camera used: Sony DSC F505 Judge's comments: Another impressive & colorful composition, I don't think I have ever seen you submit a bad or boring photograph here. Also, I've been thinking that maybe Mariette should just post one POTD per day. I don't want to overwhelm her with work right as she steps into the judging position, she'll quit on me! :) Then, I can login and post a second and third POTD whenever the submission volume warrants doing so. That seems to make [more] sense.

Photo of the Day (B Series) for July 13, 2003 -- Plein Air Painting urlLink Photographer: Lesley Mattuchio Comments: Recently I had the opportunity to photograph several artists while they painting Plein Air..."outside". I used a 24-70mm f/2.8 L lens. Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: Fort Sewall, Marblehead, MA Judge's comments: Great composition, Lesley! I like how the painter's actual subject (the landscape) is right there in the background.

Photo of the Day (A Series) for July 13, 2003 -- Fly By urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: Found this fly while photographing flowers at a local garden. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City, Texas Judge's comments: This is a great macro shot! From now on, Shutterline will regularly have two to three Photo of the Day images, as opposed to the current one. It just isn't fair to receive so many good submissions each day and to have only one appear here for the world to view. On heavy submission days (like today) we will try posting up to three images: A Series, B Series, and C Series. These are not to be confused with the terms first, second, and third... It is simply a means of classifying each one, so that in the urlLink forums we can say "Hey, Bob, great job on your A Series POTD today." In other words, all three are equally prestigious as far as we're concerned. And calling them A Series, B Series, etc sounds slightly cooler than #1, #2, and #3. More importantly, I believe this will be my last day as POTD judge. Mariette, who is an amazing photographer and actually already runs her own popular photography site ( urlLink MyDigiShots.com ) will be taking over. I was going to let her select today's photo, but she's probably asleep by now (she lives in the Netherlands I believe, so there is a time difference of at least 8 hours. That's a total guess, so if anyone actual knows the time difference please let me know.) Congratulations to Mariette on the new judging position.

Photos of the Day for July 26, 2003 Life -- "Hopper" urlLink Photographer: Lyn Winans Photographer's comments: - Camera used: Olympus E20 Geo. location: Minden,ON,Canada Judge's comments: Great colors and detail of this hopper macro. Congrats! Inanimate -- Sunset at Mono Lake urlLink Photographer: J. Pedersen Photographer's comments: We camped only about 5 miles from here during our May vacation. It was beautiful! Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Great colors and beautiful scenery. I think you did a fine job showing the depth in the landscape with the mountains. Congrats Janet, a very impressive picture. Objects & Open -- Screen Shot Gerbera urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Photographer's comments: I saw this a couple of times on Better Photo and gave it a try. It was a rather hurried experiment. The lighting was OK but the set up was wrong and needs to be more sturdy. I sprayed water on a piece of one foot wide screen I bought and stood it long ways in front of the vase with a flower in it. I tried three different flowers and this miniature gerbera worked best due to its smaller size and greater distance from the screen. I will try it again, better I hope. I used a 1x, 2x and a 4x close up filters on the camera set at super macro mode. Camera used: Fuji FP S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Well Robert, try again and show it again, especially if you really think it will be better than this one. I think it is a great effect! I like the colors and the reflections. Congrats and... keep 'fooling around' to surprise us!

Photos of the Day for July 25, 2003 Life -- Little Bug ... Big Antennas urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Photographer's comments: A tiny grasshopper, no longer than the fingernail on my small finger. The hardest part was getting the focus right (the macro attachment makes for a rather narrow DOF) and keeping other blades of grass out of the picture. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: I love the picture, as well as the title. The animal looks pretty smal indeed and since green on green is difficult to focus at I think you did a marvellous job. Congrats! Inanimate -- Salt Lake LDS Temple urlLink Photographer: Ron Case Photographer's comments: - Camera used: Kodak DC3400 Geo. location: Wellsville UT Judge's comments: Great picture of a beautiful scene. To be honest I would have straighten the horizontal line a little to make it perfect. Colors and reflection are great. Congrats Ron with this picture. Objects & Open -- R.C. urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Photographer's comments: Found this nostalgic scene at an antique store near Houston Texas Camera used: Sony DSC Geo. location: Texas City, Texas Judge's comments: I think you had a great eye to motice the yellow and the blue together with these old stuff. Very attractive picture which reflects the atmosphere of the antiques really well. Next time I would like to join you on your tours! Congrats Bob.

Photos of the Day for July 24, 2003 Life -- Wings urlLink Photographer: Sue Shirk Photographer's comments: These butterflies were congregating near the creek by our cabin in the mountains of PA. They let me get pretty close before they flew away. I think they are Monarchs, but I could be wrong. I know they sure are pretty. Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Great shot. Something different than normal, where we get to see just the one butterfly. Congrats! Inanimate Nature -- Inner Strength urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Photographer's comments: I liked the dark purples around he yellow center. :) Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: Beautiful colors and detail in this flower macro. Photos of the Day for July 23, 2003 Life -- Peep urlLink Photographer: Mary Ann Melton Photographer's comments: This little duckling lives in a city park along Brushy Creek. He and his siblings had just come out of the water. They were busy shaking themselves off and grooming. We had just had a short shower which left the grass all covered with water drops. Camera used: Canon EOS D60 Geo. location: Brushy Creek, Round Rock, Texas Judge's comments: Very pretty picture and good and sharp detail. Very attractive and I think we all agree that this belongs to life. Congrats Mary Ann! Inanimate Nature -- Beeware urlLink Photographer: Jeffrey R. Bange Photographer's comments: Shutter Speed 1/350, Aperture 6.7, ISO 100, Focal Length 50mm Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Very pretty macro of a great flower, I think it is a echinacea if I am not mistaken. Photos of the Day for July 22, 2003 Life -- Man with hat urlLink Photographer: lou hartman Camera used: canon D30 Geo. location: northern california in a small town Judge's comments: Looks very attractive. Inanimate Nature -- Oak Alley urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Photographer's comments: Oak Alley is the main house of an antebellum sugar plantation just North of New Orleans. This beautiful plantation house is over 200 years old and the long entrance from the river is lined with 350 year old Oak trees. This "alley" was used in the movie Interview With A Vampire. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City, Texas Judge's comments: Excellent picture. I like the road to the door which leads the eye to the house and the oaks form such a great alley, also leading the eye towards the house. Great atmosphere captured in this picture. Congrats Bob. Objects & Open -- Conference Room Sunset Reflection urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Photographer's comments: This is a picture of a sunset reflected on the glass of a framed picture in our conference room at work. Curiously, the business buzz word in the framed picture is FOCUS. Camera used: Fuji FP S602 Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Great colors and spotted well. I like also in this picture, like Bobs picture, the atmosphere that is being reflected. I can feel being in the room and looking out of the window. Congrats Robert.

Photos of the Day for July 21, 2003 Black and White -- Lurking in the shadows urlLink Photographer: Margaret Schmidt Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: / Judge's comments: I really had to look twice. What was I looking at? But then I realized that the animal was obviously behind some sort of a fence. Great idea. It looks very attractive and reflects the shadow idea very well. Congrats Margaret. Macro -- Foursome urlLink Photographer: Gerda Grice Photographer's comments: These yellow flowers are fairly large--much bigger than the little, tiny pink flowers I've seen that have similar skinny, spiky-looking petal. I ran across them in Edwards Gardens park where Dermot and I went shooting yesterday. That particular park, incidentally, is really pretty and a lot of people choose to have their wedding pictures taken there. We ran into two wedding photo shoots there yesterday--and that was a Friday. Camera used: Nikon CP 4500 Geo. location: Edwards Gardens park Judge's comments: Great flowers Gerda. I like the green and yellow tones of the picture.

Photos of the Day for July 20, 2003 Animals -- He said She said urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City, Texas Judge's comments: Oh no.... not another animal shot :-) Well I am sorry I could not resist this picture. Photos of the Day for July 31, 2003 Life -- In A Dream urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Photographer's comments: I almost threw this photo away because it was totally skewed (I rotated about 25 degrees) and I knew I'd loose too much background to keep everything in. But, I tried anyway, and used a very large rubber stamp to extend the (relatively even) background, then cropped and did my usual post-processing. This is the reason why the flower stem seems to just fade away. I'm happy with the result and glad I didn't give up on the shot :) Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: Great picture, and good that you explain the postprocessing. I think more people should add their equipment and postprocessing so that we can also learn from eachother! That is one of the goals of the POTD ofcourse. Congrats. Photos of the Day for August 7, 2003 Life -- "Are YOU My Mama?" urlLink Photographer: jim carper Photographer's comments: A young Little Blue Heron grabs hold of a passing adult in search of a meal......from the way things went after this, I'm not sure this was one of its' parents....the blue adult didn't seem to have any food, and they weren't actually near a nest anyway! Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: St. Augustine, Florida Judge's comments: Oh ehm.. well what can I say. Jim, now you really have to come up with some other birds ;-) Great shot and I really like the title of the picture. It made me smile. I also enjoyed the colors, detail and composition. Congrats Jim.
