Photos of the Day for August 6, 2003 Life -- "Riley in Thought" urlLink Photographer: Lyn Winans Photographer's comments: - Camera used: Olympus E20 Geo. location: Minden,ON,Canada Judge's comments: I like the point of view from where this photo is taken. Maybe the left eye is a little dark, but that is my eye maybe ;-) Lovely shot of a lovely animal. Inanimate -- Green Window in Old Distillery Wall urlLink Photographer: Gerda Grice Photographer's comments: Back in the 1830s, a very large distillery was established by a firm called Gooderham & Worts. They built several buildings in an area of what is now downtown Toronto. Up until about 10 years ago, I believe, the distillery still functioned as a distillery. Now the area has been converted into a site where local artists and artisans sell their work--and photographers can have a ball photographing what is said to be the best preserved set of Victorian buildings in North America. We just visited the area for the first time today. I'm planning to go back as soon as I can. Camera used: Nikon CP 4500 Geo. location: Toronto Judge's comments: Great color and good capture of what you saw there! I like the detail and the contrast in the photo. Objects & Open -- You Go Girl!! urlLink Photographer: Ron Case Photographer's comments: My community has a small arena where various rodeo type events are held throughout the summer. I went recently to watch Team Roping. I have never tried to photograph this type of event before thinking that my little 'point & shoot' Kodak couldn't handle the conditions. I was nearly correct. My camera doesn't have any manual override settings, so I was forced to let it make it own adjustments. I took over 100 shots that night and only about a half-dozen are usable. It was a good experience to practice panning and learning to overcome the cameras shortcomings. Although I was standing right at the edge of the arena I was still too far away to use my flash to help stop the action. The lighting was several large halogen pole lights and they were bright enough. The only setting I could change was to turn the auto-focus off and set the camera to infinity. When I did this it was much easier to frame the picture in the viewfinder and pan along. I tried to follow either the horse or the cow. This shot was made panning the horse and its head seem to be in pretty good focus with the rest of the shot showing the motion. What did I learn from this? First, stick with it. This was about the fourth from the last shot I took. Second, not every shot has to be crystal clear and sharp. I like the way the motion is shown in this shot. Third, don't be afraid to try new things. Fourth, I need (or it is want) a new camera. Technical details: exposure 1/10 of a second. Aperture f3.8. Focal length 12.6 mm. No flash. I added a 2x teleconverter to some of the shoots including this one. Slight Photoshop Elements modifications for color correction, brightness, etc. For the most part, this is straight out of the camera. Camera used: Wellsville UT Geo. location: Kodak DC3400 Judge's comments: I know that this does not fit into 'open' entirely since Ron pointed out that the picture is almost straight from the camera. But it is a great shot and the idea of movement is spectacular. I can almost imagine being there and hear people screaming. Congrats on this shot.

Photos of the Day for August 5, 2003 Life -- Heron close-up urlLink Photographer: Lisa Haskins Photographer's comments: Since we were separated by a few feet of water this guy felt comfortable enough to hang around and let me take his picture. Camera used: Canon 10d, 70-200mm Geo. location: Amsterdam Judge's comments: Another great bird shot with a lot of detail! Very good colors and background. Inanimate -- "Lily" urlLink Photographer: Jeffrey R. Bange Photographer's comments: Settings: SS 1/250, Aperture 5.2, Focal Length 300mm, ISO 100 Description: This picture was taken at the Lily Pond on Pepsi's World Headquarters property in New York which is open to the public on weekends. Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: NY Judge's comments: Great colors on this one too. I keep repeating myself I guess. I like the composition of this flower shot and the softness. Objects & Open -- Cantina Window urlLink Photographer: J Pedersen Photographer's comments: This was taken at Seaport Village in San Diego. It's right on the harbor and has lots of shops, cafes, etc. This photo is of a restaurant window. Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: San Diego Judge's comments: Nice capture and a lot of people would have walked past this I think. Great colors and detail.

Photos of the Day for August 4, 2003 Life -- "Flyboy" urlLink Photographer: jim carper Photographer's comments: In flight shot of a Great Egret taken at the Alligator Farm on August 1, 2003 with my Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the 10d. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: St. Augustine, Florida Judge's comments: Yes. Another Jim Carper bird and again excellent. Congrats Jim on this beautiful shot of this flying bird. Inanimate -- Natural Fire urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Photographer's comments: like how using shallow DOF on flowers lets me highlight just specific parts. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: What a great fire and colors. Fine capture. Congrats. Objects & Open -- One Man's Treasure urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Photographer's comments: This is a scene I shot in Deer Park Texas. It was kind of bland looking so I did some PS work on it. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City, Texas Judge's comments: Nice artwork on a great picture. Would have cropped just a little on the bottom to prevent that diagonal line to make it perfect. Congrats Bob.

Photos of the Day for August 3, 2003 Life -- Young Girl urlLink Photographer: Louis Hartman Photographer's comments: - Camera used: canon d 30 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Great skin tone, expression and detail. Congrats. Louis, maybe you can add some comments to the shots you submit? Inanimate -- Blue Clouds urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Photographer's comments: Well someone saw this wonderful reflection of clouds on Graduate Hospital and just started snapping away without remembering to check the white balance and ISO from the night before. Liked the effect. Camera used: Fuji FP S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Well.. the effect is good. Glad someone noticed the colors and reflections. Congrats! Objects & Open -- Church urlLink Photographer: J. Pedersen Photographer's comments: A little church I saw and did a very little DA Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Great shot, like the digital artwork. Maybe the window half a degree rotation to make it perfect? Nope, I looked for the third time now and now I don't see it anymore. Strange, but obviously an intriguing picture which you keep looking at! Congrats!

Photos of the Day for August 16, 2003 Life -- "Delicate" urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Photographer's comments: I like the soft colors of this shot.....gives a rather delicate look to it, I think. Taken at the St. Augustine, Florida, Alligator Farm on August 11, 2003 using my Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the 10d. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: St. Augustine, Florida Judge's comments: Alligator farm? Hope I did not mix up pictures because I don't see an alligator but one of Jim's great white egrets ( I think it is anyway). Jim, I think I am coming over to your place to make some shots of these great birds, or at least take lessons from you how to capture these animals. Great shot again. Inanimate -- Rain Victim urlLink Photographer: Gerda Grice Photographer's comments: I took this picture in the City Hall Square downtown a few days ago after a rain shower. I used my camera's Macro mode. ISO 100, FL 16.2mm; f/6.3, SS 1/124. Camera used: Nikon CP 4500 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Great colors and detail of this flower! Congrats Gerda. Objects & Open -- "Venice" urlLink Photographer: Boris Myslovaty (Israel) Photographer's comments: Venice Camera used: Fuji 4900z (manual) Geo. location: Venice Judge's comments: I like the picture because of the colors and the chosen angle. However again, border is a little bit too strong to my taste? But the atmosphere of Venice is very well captured in the picture. Congrats

Photos of the Day for August 15, 2003 Life -- A Thirsty Goose urlLink Photographer: Janet Pedersen Photographer's comments: - Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: I like the composition and the angle from which this shot was taken from, taking the bending of the neck into account. Add the fact that geese don't like people too close by and I think it is a remarkable shot. Inanimate -- Rainbow Bouquet urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Photographer's comments: I went to one my florists and just decided to get bold colors. Brought the flowers home, arranged them and shot away Camera used: Fuji FP S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: This made me smile. Lovely shot of this bunch of flowers. Can't imagine it in a vase at home, but as shot it does well! Congrats. Objects & Open -- Silver Lake in B&W urlLink Photographer: Janet Pedersen Photographer's comments: his was taken in the Sierra Mountains in California in May 2003 Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: Sierra Mountains Judge's comments: Great shot of the lake and very good in these tones.

Photos of the Day for August 14, 2003 Life -- SHHH! They're sleeping! urlLink Photographer: Mary Ann Melton Photographer's comments: This picture was taken at a park near my home. This park is located underneath a very busy interstate highway. I followed this set of ducklings and watched them come out of the water following their mom. They proceeded to preen themselves and dry off. Then they curled up together for an afternoon nap. Camera used: Canon EOS D60 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: So sweet! Great detail and good colors of these littl'uns. Inanimate -- Butterfly on Sunflower urlLink Photographer: Shari A. Malin Photographer's comments: A large sunflower with an electric blue butterfly perched on the edge. Camera used: Sony DSC-F717 Geo. location: Scotland County, North Carolina Judge's comments: Great shot. Congrats! Objects & Open -- Plastic Ware urlLink Photographer: Margaret Satchell Photographer's comments: These were stacked up in a house wares store display and i was struck by the colors. I used photoshop and applied a simple edge accentuation filter to jazz it up a bit but the colors are true. Camera used: Olympus c4040 Geo. location: Kingston, Ontario Judge's comments: Great picture and nice colors. Congrats!

Photos of the Day for August 13, 2003 Life -- PushMe PullYou urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Photographer's comments: Before they become beautiful orange and black butterflies, Monarchs look like this. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City, Texas Judge's comments: Great macro shot of a butterfly to be. Inanimate -- Angled Reflections of Clouds urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Photographer's comments: The west end of the Commerce Square Building II. Camera angled, hand held, f 2.8, 0.001 sec., ISO 200. Camera used: Fuji FP S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Another great building picture. Congrats! Objects & Open -- "Nun-buoy" urlLink Photographer: Boris Myslovaty (Israel) Photographer's comments: - Camera used: Fuji 4900z(manual) Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Great colors and composition. Border is a little bit heavy to my taste but nevertheless a good picture!

Photos of the Day for August 12, 2003 Life -- Skateboarder urlLink Photographer: Lisa Haskins Photographer's comments: - Camera used: Canon 10D, 70-200mm Geo. location: MuseumPlein, Amsterdam Judge's comments: Great actionshot. Congrats. Inanimate -- Heliathemum urlLink Photographer: Lisa Haskins Photographer's comments: - Camera used: Canon 10D, 100mm macro Geo. location: Hortus Botanicus, Amsterdam Judge's comments: Good shot of a flower with good detail and DOF. Objects & Open -- "Canoe in foggy dawn" urlLink Photographer: Margaret Satchell Photographer's comments: Canoeing across the Lake of Two Rivers at 5 am. Camera used: Olympus c4040 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: You captured a great atmosphere here and you have choosen an excellent angle to shoot from. Congrats!

Photos of the Day for August 11, 2003 Life -- Flip, Flop, and Fly urlLink Photographer: jim carper Photographer's comments: This young Snowy Egret was perched precariously on this flimsy branch while giving his wing muscles a really good workout. Photo taken August 1, 2003 at the St. Augustine Alligator Farm. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d w/Canon 100-400mm lens Geo. location: St. Augustine, Florida Judge's comments: Sigh! Another great bird shot! Congrats on this beautiful shot Jim. Inanimate -- Nestled urlLink Photographer: Cheryl Meisel Photographer's comments: Taken in my backyard using my infra red on my camera with a filter. I have always loved infra red pictures. I was told once it would become "old hat" but I am still waiting lol. Settings: SS: 1/60, Aperture: 2.0, Program: NIGHT SHOT, Hand held. UNcropped, Lowered KBs for the net. Camera used: Sony 707 Geo. location: Erie, MI Judge's comments: Great shot Cheryl. I also love IR shots. It always is a special effect with those pictures. Thanks for sharing your settings. Objects & Open -- Bearded Iris urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Photographer's comments: Shot these Iris in San Francisco. I used Photoshop and AutoFX to achieve this effect Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Very nicely done Bob. I can see that the shots of the Iris are also great and together with some good PS work makes this even more special.

Photos of the Day for August 10, 2003 Life -- Photoshopped cat urlLink Photographer: Lyn Winans Photographer's comments: - Camera used: Olympus E20 Geo. location: Minden,ON,Canada Judge's comments: Great shot of a beautiful cat! Congrats. Inanimate -- Water Wheels urlLink Photographer: Ron Case Photographer's comments: These are water wheels used for irrigating large fields. I like the different geometric shapes. Camera used: Kodak DC3400 Geo. location: Wellsville UT Judge's comments: Also a good capture. Indeed good shapes and very well chosen point of view. Congrats! Objects & Open -- Multiplication urlLink Photographer: Gerda Grice Photographer's comments: These are reflections on to the inner, concave curve of a large building built of reflective material. The angle of the building or some other factor has made some of the objects being reflected multiply in number. So, for example, the flag, which, as far as I can remember was just one, single flag, but in the reflection, it became many. Camera used: Nikon CP 4500 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Great shot and well seen. I also like the colors and composition of the building on the picture. Congrats.

Photos of the Day for August 23, 2003 Life -- Speed By Design urlLink Photographer: Lesley Mattuchio Photographer's comments: This is a Common Tern which is similar to the Artic Tern. It's lots of fun to watch these birds that nature has so wonderfully designed for stealth and speed. I used a 100-400mm f/4.5-5.6 L IS lens and I tracked the Tern with it to get this and similar shots at the Parker River National Wildlife refuge. Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: Plum Island, Newburyport, MA. , USA Judge's comments: Great shot of a bird in action. Perfect would have been some more space on the left where the bird is heading to, but well... we can't control everything in nature ;-) Congrats with this photo. Inanimate -- California Coast II urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Photographer's comments: Taken along the Coastal highway north of Pebble Beach. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Pebble Beach Judge's comments: Great view of a beautiful spot. Objects & Open -- Early Evening Reflections urlLink Photographer: Gerda Grice Photographer's comments: I took this picture Thursday evening, as I was walking up Yonge Street (Toronto's main north-south street) trying to get home during the blackout. I had stopped for a bit of a rest, and I noticed these quite interesting reflections on a building across the street. Camera used: Olympus C-3020Z Geo. location: Toronto Judge's comments: Great reflections and colors. Congrats!

Photos of the Day for August 22, 2003 Life -- Prehistoric urlLink Photographer: Julia Mazza Photographer's comments: I found this prehistoric creature while at Ft. Desoto Beach in St. Petersburg, FL. The horseshoe crab is one of the very few living creatures that has remained on earth unchanged since the beginning of time. Camera used: Sony MVC F707 Geo. location: Clearwater, FL Judge's comments: Great detail and clarity of this creature. I also like the small fish you can see in the water. Crystal clear shot. Inanimate -- Another World urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Photographer's comments: I *finally* bought a photo editing program that has a channel mixer, and of course I immediately had to try it out on one of my old (last November) infrared photos. I switched the red and blue channel, then removed some of the red hue from the church. Levels, resize and USM and here we are - a totally different yet recognizable world :) Camera used: Canon PS Pro90 IS Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: Yes! I know how this works and it looks great! Well done and congrats! Objects & Open -- Wonder Wheel urlLink Photographer: Margaret Satchell Photographer's comments: This was taken at night at Coney Island. I used an edge accentuating filter and jazzed up the color a bit with PSE. Camera used: Olympus c4040 Geo. location: Coney Island, New York Judge's comments: Very nice and it made me feel good, longing for a drive in this wonder wheel.

Photos of the Day for August 21, 2003 Life -- Slow and Steady urlLink Photographer: Sue Shirk Photographer's comments: This little guy was crawling on a leaf in my back yard. I always like to watch the way their little eyes come out as they crawl. Geo. location: York Haven Pennsylvania Judge's comments: Great shot of this slow creature! Congrats.. Inanimate -- Another Flower Shot urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Photographer's comments: Saw this beautiful Iris in a park by the bay in San Francisco. Some people say oh it's another flower shot but, I enjoy looking at and shooting flowers. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City, Texas Judge's comments: Great detail and excellent colors. Objects & Open -- Colors urlLink Photographer: louis hartman Photographer's comments: - Camera used: canon d30 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Nice capture and well seen. Congrats.

Photos of the Day for August 20, 2003 Life -- Almost Naptime urlLink Photographer: Mary Ann Melton Photographer's comments: My husband had seen a group of ducklings at this park and told me about it. I went over to see them and photograph them. I got to watch them come out of the water, shake all the water off, groom themselves, and settle down for an afternoon nap. Camera used: Canon EOS D60 Geo. location: Round Rock, Texas - a city park Judge's comments: What a lovely shot of these littl'uns. Congrats. Inanimate -- Dande Inside urlLink Photographer: Cheryl Meisel Photographer's comments: Macro shot of the inside of a big dandelion type weed found roadside. Other then sharpening this is out an out of the camera shot. Settings of : Manual, Aperture: F8.0, ISO: 100, SS:1/100, Camera used: Sony 707 Geo. location: Erie, MI Judge's comments: Great detail of the dandelion! Objects & Open -- Government in Action urlLink Photographer: J. Pedersen Photographer's comments: While on vacation we stopped in to watch the Nevada State Senate. Just a little DA added. Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Nicely done, very nice effect with the colors left on the picture. Congrats!

Photos of the Day for August 19, 2003 Life -- Butterfly on glass urlLink Photographer: Gerda Grice Photographer's comments: I saw this little butterfly fluttering around on a glass window of a large office building. He kept moving around and I kept shooting for several minutes. This is one of the shots I took. Manual exp.; ISO 100; FL 32mm; ss 1/250, f/5.8. Camera used: Nikon CP 4500 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Great butterfly Gerda and very original like this, on the glass with that reflection. Congrats! Inanimate -- Almost Fluffy urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Photographer's comments: Some sort of plant (have no idea what it is) that I saw in Iceland. I like how the background came out almost in pencil strokes. Now, if only I could recreate that at will! :) Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Iceland Judge's comments: Nice shot of indeed a fluffy plant. Congrats. Objects & Open -- Mannekins in the Market urlLink Photographer: Lisa Haskins Photographer's comments: I liked the contrasting expressions in these three. I did do some sharpening in Photoshop otherwise they are as I found them. Camera used: Canon 10D, 50mm Geo. location: Albert Cuyp Market, Amsterdam Judge's comments: This shot gave me a laugh. Very humouristic and nice colors.

Photos of the Day for August 18, 2003 Life -- " Coquettish Crowned Crane" urlLink Photographer: Boris Myslovaty (Israel) Photographer's comments: - Camera used: Pentax Optio 550 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Great detail and colors in this picture! Inanimate -- The Last Rays urlLink Photographer: J. Pedersen Photographer's comments: - Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Yes I know, it is also life, well that is, i think that man on the bench was still alive when Janet 'shot him'. But It is also a scenery shot and a very nice one, so I decided to have it in this category instead. Congrats Janet, very nice colors and atmosphere. Objects & Open -- Love is in the Air urlLink Photographer: Cheryl Meisel Photographer's comments: My first try at a new add on lens. It was already too dark when this shot was taken and his little wings were going like crazy. I didn't think I would even get a shot at these conditions. I left the blur on the wings just like they were and softened this a bit because I liked the effect more. I added some cloud effects to the BG as it just fit the photo. All in all I fell in love with the shot lol. Ahhhhh Settings of : Manual, Aperture: F2.4, ISO: 100, SS:1/15 Camera used: Sony 707 Geo. location: Erie, MI. Judge's comments: I really liked this shot. It has something soft and sweet! Congrats!

Photos of the Day for August 17, 2003 Life -- Pelican Leap urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Photographer's comments: Great White Pelican leaps into flight. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City, Texas Judge's comments: Great bird shot, excellent detail, colors and composition. Congrats! Inanimate -- A Fall Wardrobe urlLink Photographer: J. Pedersen Photographer's comments: Just something that caught my eye, it was in the store dressing room area. Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Very original idea and nice work. Congrats! Objects & Open -- Green Stripes and Shapes urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Photographer's comments: Having shot away my lunch/dinner hour one day last week, I came back to the office. I looked up in the vestibule of the office and saw a fluorescent light fixture in the ceiling. I thought it interesting and took a few shots of it. When I got back to my desk, I saw the color and remembered that I had not changed the white balance from sunny. I think the color was also influenced by a warm circular polarizer filter still on the camera. I liked the color so here it is. (f/ 2.8, 0.0025 sec., ISO 160, macro mode) Camera used: Fuji FP S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Great colors and very attractive shot. Congrats!

Photos of the Day for August 30, 2003 Life -- Screech Owl urlLink Photographer: Elaine Wallace Photographer's comments: I fell in love with this Screech Owl at a Nature Preserve in New Hampshire. It didn't 'screech', but almost 'purred' instead. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: New Hampshire Judge's comments: Excellent capture and good depth of field. Those big screech owl eyes are pretty amazing. Congrats! Inanimate -- Raindrop urlLink Photographer: Lisa Haskins Photographer's comments: Taken while stuck inside on a rainy day in Amsterdam. Saw the drops forming on the balcony railings and tried to take some macro shots with the light coming through. This is my favorite of the experiments. Camera used: Canon 10D, 100mm macro Geo. location: Amsterdam Judge's comments: A creative take and an interesting macro. Congrats! Objects & Open -- High Concept urlLink Photographer: Margaret Satchell Photographer's comments: Taken at BCE place in Toronto...I was just looking for the Hockey Hall of Fame and came upon this towering corridor. The original is in color; I thought the subject lent itself to black and white. Camera used: Olympus C4040 Geo. location: Toronto, Ontario Judge's comments: You're right -- black & white does make this image complete. Congrats!

Photos of the Day for August 29, 2003 Life -- Come On Make My Day! urlLink Photographer: Kaye Grogan Photographer's comments: This Tiger looked ready for his lunch--and I think he was considering me. :-) Camera used: - Geo. location: Zoo near Myrtle Beach Judge's comments: I hope you didn't get too close to take this photo; I certainly wouldn't have. Great shot though. Congrats! (Next time please tell us what camera you used as well) Inanimate -- Mackinac Bridge Reflections urlLink Photographer: Mary Ann Melton Photographer's comments: This beautiful bridge has a 5 mile span. It links the upper and lower part of Michigan near Mackinaw. This is one of the two main supports. Camera used: Canon EOS D60 Geo. location: Michigan Judge's comments: Excellent inanimate composition, congrats on your win! Objects & Open -- A New Day urlLink Photographer: Jeffrey R. Bange Photographer's comments: Aperture 6.7, Shutter Speed 1/125, ISO 100, Focal Length 53mm Picture was taken early one morning in August on the beach in Cape May New Jersey before anyone had arrived for the day. Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: Cape May, NJ Judge's comments: Good framing and an excellent mood to it -- makes me feel sorry that summer is almost over. Also, thanks for the technical photography details, it's useful to other members.

Note: Our amazing photo contest judge, Mariette, will be out of town enjoying a break until Tuesday. I will be temporarily filling in to judge & post the winners until then. All of you talented photographers make my job a real challenge! Have fun, Mariette.

Photos of the Day for August 28, 2003 Life -- Gia urlLink Photographer: Julia Mazza Photographer's comments: This is a shot of my dearest pet on earth, "Gia". She is a Miniature Schnauzer and is just shy of a year old. She has a way of communicating with me without words. I felt this photo conveyed that. Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: Clearwater, Florida Judge's comments: Great photo of an amazing dog! I have a Miniature Schnauzer, too, best pet in the world with lots of personality. Inanimate -- Summer Sunset Reflections urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Photographer's comments: We have had hardly any good sunsets in Philadelphia this year. Not compared to last year. But the one on this past Tuesday was a stunner. The reflections are in the buildings of Commerce Square. The shot was taken from the 19th floor of the office building where I work. (f/ 2.8, 1/170 sec., ISO 400, aperture priority, UV and circular polarizer filters, hand held, 07:35pm) Camera used: Fuji FP S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Great sunset cityscape, and a neat composition. Thanks for the details about how you took this shot (I was wondering if you used a polarizer for it before I read your comments!) Objects & Open -- Happy Barn! urlLink Photographer: Ron Case Photographer's comments: This barn is located in Southern Idaho and is owned by a local religious leader. One day the Boy Scouts in his area got together and painted his barn for him as a 'thank you'. They couldn't resist adding their own special touch to the job. It's a delight to be driving down the street and see this barn staring back at you. Camera used: Kodak DC3400 Geo. location: Wellsville, UT Judge's comments: A great composition, even without the funny addition to the barn and the interesting story. Congrats!

Photos of the Day for August 27, 2003 Life -- California Gull urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Photographer's comments: I know that everything is bigger in Texas but, ...... these Gulls dwarf the ones we have here on the Texas Gulf Coast. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City, Texas Judge's comments: What a great capture of this gull! Great detail and colors. I like the eye as well. Congrats Bob. Inanimate -- "Well Done!" urlLink Photographer: Dennis Castellano Photographer's comments: - Camera used: Nikon Coolpix Geo. location: Hendersonville, North Carolina Judge's comments: Very nice shot and detail in the wall. I also like the composition. However, maybe i am wrong and forgive me in that case, but I think you changed the sky. That is not a problem for me, but I think I can see some artefacts? Congrats on this picture. Objects & Open -- DC Reflection urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Photographer's comments: I just love taking photos of reflections :) Camera used: Canon PS Pro90 IS Geo. location: Washington, DC Judge's comments: Great capture and well seen. Congrats!

Photos of the Day for August 26, 2003 Life -- Smoke urlLink Photographer: Lisa Haskins Photographer's comments: I took this in the tunnel under the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam. There was a troop of mongolian musicians playing...I took quite a few shots of them but liked this more informal one the best. By the way, it was very dark and I had the iso set to 800, a tribute to how clean the images are from the 10D at high speeds! Camera used: Canon 10D, 70-200mm Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Great colors and detail and the smole is great. Congrats. Inanimate -- Small People, Big Mural urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Photographer's comments: Philadelphia has over 2,200 murals throughout the city. This is a small portion of Meg Seligman's 2002 mural 'Visual Arts Theatre on the Avenue of the Arts' which has some passersby in it to show scale. The mural is includes many media: painting, mosaic, sculpture just to name a few. It depicts the arts of dance, theatre, circus, physical, costume and scene design and architecture to name a few. Camera used: Fuji FP S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Great shot, very good colors. But I cropped the picture next to the building to left it out and it looked a little stronger? But never mind my comments, great shot! Objects & Open -- Lighthouse Keeper's Desk urlLink Photographer: Mary Ann Melton Photographer's comments: While visiting the Grand Traverse Lighthouse, there were several areas that drew my attention for photographs. This desk with its lamp and old typewriter seemed to have good lighting. All photography had to be natural lighting, because flash is prohibited because it is historically preserved. I thought that the sepia would be in keeping with the historical nature of the setting. Camera used: Canon EOS D60 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Very nice composition and colors. Congrats on this shot, good atmosphere on this one. Photos of the Day for August 25, 2003 Life -- "The Visitor" urlLink Photographer: jim carper Photographer's comments: Photo of a Wood Stork (the only stork found in the US) taken August 1, 2003 at the Alligator Farm in St. Augustine with the Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the 10d. The Wood Stork is on the Endangered Species list, but seem to be pretty plentiful here in North Florida. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: St. Augustine, Florida Judge's comments: Great stork picture and great capture of his landing. Congrats Jim.

Photos of the Day for August 25, 2003 Life -- "The Visitor" urlLink Photographer: jim carper Photographer's comments: Photo of a Wood Stork (the only stork found in the US) taken August 1, 2003 at the Alligator Farm in St. Augustine with the Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the 10d. The Wood Stork is on the Endangered Species list, but seem to be pretty plentiful here in North Florida. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: St. Augustine, Florida Judge's comments: Great stork picture and great capture of his landing. Congrats Jim. Inanimate -- "Car washing" urlLink Photographer: Boris Myslovaty (Israel) Photographer's comments: - Camera used: Pentax Optio 550 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Yes, I should have this done. Car wash.... Great idea and nice effect. Objects & Open -- "Fun City" urlLink Photographer: Lyn Winans Photographer's comments: - Camera used: Olympus E20 Geo. location: Minden, ON Judge's comments: Great shot, nice colors and detail Indeed fun!.

Photos of the Day for August 24, 2003 Life -- What's Up? urlLink Photographer: Sherry March Photographer's comments: - Camera used: Nikon Coolpix 995 Geo. location: Wellsville, PA Judge's comments: Great shot and very well chosen angle to shoot from. Congrats! Inanimate -- Blue Dahlia urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Photographer's comments: I got a new 10x close up filter and did some macro shots of flowers in the makeshift studio. This is one of them. (f/ 4.5, 0.4 sec., ISO 160, circular polarizer and 10x close up filters, tripod mounted) Camera used: Fuji FP S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Great detail and color. I also like the DOF used for this one. Congrats on this lovely shot. Objects & Open -- Water Lily urlLink Photographer: Janet Pedersen Photographer's comments: Just a little more DA. I'm having fun with it. Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: I like the coloring of this DA picture. I guess the original is good too by the looks of the composition! Congrats.

Photo of the Day for September 6, 2003 -- Gulls at Sunset urlLink Photographer: Matt Welch Comments: Taken on the Outer Banks of North Carolina at sunset. Camera used: Canon EOS 10D with 28-135IS at 135mm Geo. location: Outer Banks, NC Judge's comments: Great capture; the depth of field is excellent and the way the waves "frame" the photo is also very cool. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for September 5, 2003 -- Atlantic Sunrise urlLink Photographer: Tom Dickson Comments: Sunrise at York Harbor, Maine Camera used: Canon 10D Geo. location: York Harbor, Maine Judge's comments: Great image, almost surreal looking! It's rare to have a new member win the Photo of the Day contest on their first attempt, but Tom's submission is clearly "the right stuff" at Shutterline. Welcome and congrats! Less importantly, thanks to everyone who has purchased cool merchandise from the urlLink Shutterline Gear store! Your purchase(s) help Shutterline and give us the money necessary to keep the photo contests alive and challenging. Also, I believe that Shutterline premium mousepads are on sale for a limited time.

Photo of the Day for September 4, 2003 -- Cloud Croft urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: This is a view from a scenic overlook in Cloud Croft, New Mexico. White Sands can be seen in the distance. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Cloud Croft, NM Judge's comments: Great landscape with very nice cloud formations. Congrats on the win!

Photo of the Day for September 3, 2003 -- Prehistoric urlLink Photographer: Shari Malin Comments: This is an antique Kodak camera I purchased over the weekend in Virginia. Camera used: Sony DSC-F717 Geo. location: Spring Lake, NC Judge's comments: Amazing shot! It really captures the "prehistoric" feel of the original Kodak cameras... They're a far cry from today's high-tech looking Kodak digital cameras. Think how far photography has gone since then. Thanks for submitting it and congrats, Shari! Unfortunately, Mariette is sick so I'll remain the photo judge until she feels up to the task. No rush whatsoever; I really enjoy picking a winner out of the pool each day. Get well soon, Mariette! :)

Photo of the Day for September 2, 2003 -- Sailing Home urlLink Photographer: Drake Olmstead Comments: I took this at South Haven Michigan, this past weekend. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Michigan Judge's comments: An amazing composition, between the beautiful sunset and the people & sailboats. Congrats! In other news, Mariette should be back in town tomorrow and will be picking up the Photos of the Day judging again. It's been fun being your temporary judge, but I think we all agree it will be good to get Mariette back over here. She has a great eye for photographic talent!

Photo of the Day for September 1, 2003 (Labor Day U.S.) -- Coney Island urlLink Photographer: Margaret Satchell Comments: The boardwalk: busy even late on a tuesday night! Camera used: Olympus C4040 Geo. location: Brooklyn, NY Judge's comments: I liked the lighting and the mood of the boardwalk was conveyed very well. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for August 31, 2003 -- A Turkey Family urlLink Photographer: Mary Ann Melton Comments: We were driving down a road in Michigan in the late afternoon. We spotted these turkeys. We came back around with me and my tripod braced on the window of the Jeep. I got about 4 or 5 pictures before she crossed the road with her babies. Camera used: Canon EOS D60 Geo. location: A roadside in Michigan Judge's comments: An excellent photo of this turkey family! You should submit something similar again around Thanksgiving time. :) Holiday cutback: Since Mariette is out of town and since I'm doing stuff with the family (not the turkey family lol) there will be only one photo posted per day until Mariette gets back and settled. Thanks for your understanding. (Incidentally, a lot of Shutterline's U.S. members are also taking it easy for the Labor Day holiday)

Photo of the Day for September 13, 2003 -- I Need a New Coat! urlLink Photographer: Sherry March Comments: -- Camera used: Nikon Coolpix 995 Geo. location: Wellsville, PA Judge's comments: Another clever animal shot from Sherry, congrats! I realize this submission is kind of old (submitted on the 3rd), but I've been saving it for the right time. By the way, feel free to submit portrait or candid shots to the site -- I think some of us want to see something new. (although the landscapes are still gladly accepted) It's been a while since we've had any people shots as Photo of the Day .

Shutterline's 9/11 Tribute urlLink Taken by one of Shutterline's members, Franziska Lang . She is well known here for her excellent photos, and she's the one who volunteers and runs the weekly photo polls for us. Franziska is currently urlLink selling this print and donating all of her profits (for this month) to the Red Cross. I think it's a pretty altruistic thing to do, so I've decided to feature it here for the world to see. Please consider buying her print.

Photo of the Day for September 12, 2003 -- Life Cycle urlLink Photographer: Sherry March Comments: -- Camera used: Nikon Coolpix 995 Geo. location: Wellsville, PA Judge's comments: An interesting, colorful macro. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for September 11, 2003 -- Vintage urlLink Photographer: Margaret Satchell Comments: The shadow of the empire state falls on a city in mourning. Camera used: Olympus C4040 Geo. location: New York City Judge's comments: A somber cityscape to remind us of the 9/11 tragedy.

Photo of the Day for September 10, 2003 -- Pier 60 at Night urlLink Photographer: Julia Mazza Comments: Taken at the famous Clearwater Beach, Pier 60 on Sept 6th, 2003. I climbed into the lifeguard station, propped my camera on the frame of the station and shot this as a 30 second exposure. If you notice, the waves are not visible, they look soft, but in such darkness, I had to go for a long exposure. This beach has a sunset celebration every night! 2 hours before and 2 hours after sunset, every night, weather permitting. They have playgrounds, etc. This is a shot of the pier itself. Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: Clearwater, FL Judge's comments: Great photo and reflections, and an interesting story about the beach. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for September 9, 2003 -- End of the Race urlLink Photographer: Patrick Eden Comments: Photograph of dinghy sailors going home at sunset after racing. Camera used: Canon EOS D30 300 f2.8 + 2x converter (960mm lens) Geo. location: Gurnard Isle of Wight, England Judge's comments: Extraordinary photograph, congrats on your first win here! I know some of you are probably sick of seeing sailing/sunset photos for this week, but this submission was just a perfect composition. Dinghy sailboat racing is a lot of fun, and this photo conveys that quite well. In other important news, urlLink iPads.com is now sponsoring the Shutterline Photo of the Month . Here's how it works: you win the Photo of the Day here, and thousands of visitors (literally) view your photo and admire your work. By winning the daily photo contest, you are automatically entered in our weekly Photo of the Week vote. Members and visitors like yourself vote on a winner. Then, at the end of September, visitors vote on their favorite weekly winner. The image with the most qualified/unique votes becomes the Photo of the Month. It's a pretty prestigious thing, since so many people will be viewing your work. And, thanks to the generous iPads sponsorship agreement, the monthly winner will receive a $75 gift certificate from them. Their site allows you to upload your photos and custom text to create personalized greeting cards, notebooks, etc. Please visit their site and buy something (tell 'em Shutterline sent you) so they realize that sponsoring Shutterline was the right choice. If all goes well, iPads is fully ready to offer this (or an even better prize) each month to the winner.

Photo of the Day for September 8, 2003 -- Day's End urlLink Photographer: Matt Welch Comments: 20 second exposure of the Golden Gate at sunset. It was actually darker than this shot would imply, but the long exposure lightened up the sky. Pleasingly, I think. I love the pink clouds reflecting the below-the-horizon sunlight. Camera used: Canon EOS 10D with Sigma 15mm fish lens Geo. location: CA Judge's comments: Another great shot, Matt! It's fairly uncommon for a new member to get two wins in the same week, so congrats on that and on the excellent composition.

Photo of the Day for September 7, 2003 -- Roller skater over the Rijksmuseum urlLink Photographer: Lisa Haskins Comments: They have a festival in Amsterdam that announces the next cultural season. One of the events is a skate off in the museumplein in front of the historic Rijksmuseum with roller skaters, cyclists and skateboarders. A lot of fun and a great opportunity to take shots! Camera used: Canon 10D, 50mm Geo. location: Museumplein, Amsterdam Judge's comments: Great shot, congrats! I'm not much of a skateboarder myself, but this is an excellent action shot.

Photo of the Day for September 20, 2003 -- Desolate Rider urlLink Photographer: Paul Michel Comments: This was taken on the desolate beach of Cumberland Island off the Coast of Georgia, USA, on August 27, 2003 at about 12 noon. Camera used: Canon Powershot G1 Geo. location: Georgia Judge's comments: Congrats on a great beach composition with a twist. The bicycle, and its shadow, really stand out.

Photo of the Day for September 19, 2003 -- The Sea Was Angry That Day, My Friend urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: Like an old man in a deli trying to send back soup. Well, something like that....still, the waves were kicked up from the passing of Isabel, and the surfers were out in force. Photo taken September 18, 2003. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d w/Canon 100-400mm lens Geo. location: Jacksonville Beach, Florida Judge's comments: Great action shot, Jim!

Photo of the Day for September 18, 2003 urlLink Photographer: Julia Mazza Comments: This is a shot of my best friend in the entire world. She is more like my sister than a friend. We've known each other since we were teenagers. We've had children together and somehow always managed to keep in touch over the years. Today she came over after getting her hair done. She wanted some photos to send to her hubby who is out of the country right now. This was my favorite. She is as beautiful inside as she is on the outside! My best friend Lori. Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: Clearwater, FL Judge's comments: I didn't realize you were also such a good portrait photographer! Congrats on your win, and congrats to your friend who will now become "famous" as thousands of Shutterline visitors log in this evening to view the winner. Hurricane heads for Shutterline: So far no flooding, just a lot of downed trees and rain. Power has gone out several times, but each time the backup seems to come on within a few minutes. If power does get knocked out, there may be a delay posting tomorrow's photo. Hopefully not though.

Photo of the Day for September 17, 2003 -- Mr. Brown And Friend urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: This Brown Pelican is all dressed up in his courting outfit. During the mating season the Brown Pelican grows a silver back and a bright yellow crown. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: -- Judge's comments: Great bird "portrait" with excellent framing and a cool background. Congrats on your win! There are so many good submissions each day now, too bad only one gets the spotlight here. If you don't win at first, keep trying. Sale extended: We've decided to extend the urlLink sale price for new memberships. So, if you want to participate in the fun photo contests here, now is the perfect time to become a member.

Photo of the Day for September 16, 2003 -- Up, Up and Away! urlLink Photographer: Bob Patterson Comments: One of the events at Leeds Castle which is near here is an annual Balloon and Bentley event where hot air balloons are matched with a vintage car - a Bentley where possible - with the idea that the balloons take off persued by their partner cars and the first crew back to the Castle in the car are the winners. The balloons take off twice a day, very early in the morning and very last thing at night - apparently they are the best times to do it. This was taken as all the balloons set off at one go and it really was a tremendous sight. As a test of the skill of the pilot, some balloons will try and gently touch the basket down on the surface of the Castle's moat ...!! Camera used: Fuji FP6800Z Geo. location: Leeds Castle, Kent, UK Judge's comments: Amazing photo for what sounds like a pretty amazing event. Thanks for submitting, Bob!

Photo of the Day for September 15, 2003 -- The Flying Burrito Brothers urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: We've just gotten in the habit of stopping by Marineland when we drive down to St. Augustine......the dolphin shows are fun to watch, and it's fun to try and capture a few images at the same time. Photo taken September 13, 2003 using a Canon 28-135mm lens attached to the 10d. Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: Marineland, Florida Judge's comments: A great action & wildlife shot, all in one! Congrats on your win and keep up the interesting shots.

Photo of the Day for September 14, 2003 -- Japanese Drummers urlLink Photographer: Calgarey Penn Comments: Photo was taken this summer at a local Japanese festival in Arlington Heights, Illinois, a suburb of Chicago. Camera used: -- Geo. location: Arlington Heights, Illinois Judge's comments: An interesting shot filled with action, congrats on your first win at Shutterline! Next time you submit an image, please include the camera you used along with your submission info. Thanks.

Photo of the Day for September 27, 2003 -- Rings of Memory urlLink Photographer: Calgarey Penn Comments: This was a shot of a collection of class rings in a store window. The camera was my Olympus C5050Z with an exposure of 1/1000 of a second at F 6.3 Camera used: Olympus C5050Z Geo. location: -- Judge's comments: Great macro, should bring back memories for a lot of Shutterliners. Congrats on your win!

Photo of the Day for September 26, 2003 -- Pepsi urlLink Photographer: Lou Hartman Comments: -- Camera used: Canon D30 Geo. location: -- Judge's comments: We posted a photo featuring a Coke the other day, so it seemed only fair to feature a Pepsi photograph today! Congrats on your win, Lou. In the future, please include the geo. location and any interesting comments along with your submission.

Photo of the Day for September 25, 2003 -- On the Eve of Isabel urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: I took this last Wednesday night. I had a feeling the sunset would be a stunner that day because of the pending storm and I was not disappointed. Taken from the 19th floor office where I work. (f/ 2.8, 0.06667 sec., ISO 200, warm circular polarizer and UV filters on camera, hand held, 07:25 PM, 09/17/2003). Camera used: Fuji FP S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Great shot, Rob, and thanks for including the useful technical info. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for September 24, 2003 urlLink Photographer: urlLink StarGaze (Shutterline screen name, winner preferred not to have their real name revealed.) Comments: Nearing the end of summer, a beautiful beach day, seemed like a refreshing idea. Camera used: Sony DSC-F717 Geo. location: Long Island, New York Judge's comments: Great shot and congrats on your [first] win here at Shutterline! The Photo of the Day is becoming really competitive, since we are getting so many submissions now, so it's always a thrill to win for the first time. If you work for Coca-Cola's marketing department, this would be a great photo to use in some of their ads.

Photo of the Day for September 23, 2003 -- Guest in Car Mirror urlLink Photographer: Boris Myslovaty Comments: -- Camera used: Pentax Optio 550 Geo. location: Israel Judge's comments: Neat shot, congrats!

Photo of the Day for September 22, 2003 urlLink Photographer: Gwen Paton Comments: Taken during the great Virginia Snow storm on Valentine's weekend 2003 at our B&B in Stanley, Virginia. I started out with my husband posing on the bench but needed two people. I asked some of our guests who were staying with us that weekend. Camera used: Nikon Coolpix 995 Geo. location: Stanley, Virginia Judge's comments: Great shot, Gwen, definitely a creative people shot! Looks like it could be on a Hallmark card. My only complaint is that the image isn't very large. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for September 21, 2003 -- Colourful Cobh urlLink Photographer: Gerda Grice Comments: Cobh (pronounced Cove) is the port for Cork, Ireland. It's a very pretty and colourful little town, and it's also very significant historically. It was the port from which most Irish immigrants sailed to North America, and it's also the last port the Titanic put in at before sinking. There are various mementos (statues, pub names, etc.) quite near the docks in the town recalling both those facts. Camera used: Nikon CP 4500 Geo. location: Cork, Ireland Judge's comments: Great shot, Gerda. You've taken a lot of impressive shots from your overseas vacation, this is no exception. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for October 4, 2003 -- Johnathon Livingston Seagull urlLink Photographer: Michelle Schultz Comments: An artistic manipulation of a seagull. Camera used: Nikon Coolpix 5700 Geo. location: Bahamas Judge's comments: Great shot, it's neat how the colors look very tropical. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for October 3, 2003 -- Shy urlLink Photographer: Louis Hartman Comments: -- Camera used: Canon D30 Geo. location: -- Judge's comments: Interesting image, makes you wonder who's behind the wall. Congrats on your win!

Photo of the Day for October 2, 2003 -- Caught! urlLink Photographer: Mariette Geest Comments: well.. something i can do sitting in my wheelchair :-) taking studiopics..... This egg is caught ;-) Camera used: Fuji S2 Geo. location: The Netherlands Judge's comments: Bizarre photo, but it's great! The shadow and the background image both make this a unique submission. Everyone at Shutterline, myself included, hope for your speedy recovery. Get well already!

Photo of the Day for October 1, 2003 -- Maelstrom urlLink Photographer: Sherry March Comments: -- Camera used: Nikon Coolpix 995 Geo. location: Wellsville, PA Judge's comments: Great black & white photo, congrats! Keep the great submissions rolling in, everyone.

Photo of the Day for September 30, 2003 -- Satiny urlLink Photographer: Kaye Grogan Comments: I used red food coloring in a saucer of water and dripped water from the spigot--to get this effect. I think the water looks like satin. Camera used: Sony Cybershot DSC-V1 Geo. location: -- Judge's comments: Congrats, Kaye! Bizarre composition, but it has a certain appeal. Also, thanks to everyone who told their family, friends, and fellow cubicle workers about the Shutterline Photo of the Day . We continue to grow in popularity every day. Kodak's still more popular, but what can you do?

Photo of the Day for September 29, 2003 -- Bridge to Emerald City urlLink Photographer: Ralph A. Velasco Comments: This is a picture I enjoyed taking in my hometown of Chicago recently while playing hooky from work. Camera used: Kodak DX3900 Zoom Geo. location: Chicago, IL Judge's comments: Great photo of Chicago, Ralph. Great framing & contrast between the bridge and the skyscrapers in the background... Congrats! Don't forget, folks! urlLink Click here to quickly tell your friends, family, and co-workers about the Shutterline Photo of the Day. Spread the word. Thanks! (We're trying to get 10,000 viewers per day here within the next two weeks)

Photo of the Day for September 28, 2003 -- Party Pix! urlLink Photographer: Dennis Castellano Comments: This is a downward shot of a pack of multi colored wooden party toothpicks. Party on Wayne! Party on Garth! Camera used: Sony Cybershot Geo. location: Asheville, NC Judge's comments: A creative, colorful macro shot. Congrats on your win!

Photo of the Day for October 11, 2003 -- River Crossing urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: A little Snowy Egret takes off for the far side of the St. Johns River. Photo taken October 6, 2003 with my Canon 100-400mm lens attached to my D30. Camera used: Canon EOS D30 Geo. location: Mayport, Florida Judge's comments: Great shot of a bird in flight again. Great detail.

Photo of the Day for October 10, 2003 -- Dapples and Shadows urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Late afternoon sun and shadows on the front of the 1700 Market Street Building. (f/ 2.8, 0.008 sec., ISO 200, warm circular polarizer and UV filters on camera, hand held, 06:05pm) Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: This picture keeps my eyes busy. I keep looking at it and try to see what I am looking at. Great colors and detail. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for October 9, 2003 -- Sunrise urlLink Photographer: Tom Dickson Comments: Near Lake Junaluska North Carolina as the sun peeked over the Smokey Mountains Camera used: Canon 10D Geo. location: Judge's comments: Great image, wonderful colors.... this picture makes me want to go on a holiday!

Photo of the Day for October 8, 2003 -- To Union Station urlLink Photographer: Sherry March Comments: - Camera used: Nikon Coolpix 995 Geo. location: Toronto Judge's comments: I like this shot, since my eye is going through the whole picture to see what is there. The lines are straight, yes, I like it. Congrats!
It's great to have Mariette back as our Photo of the Day judge. I'm glad you're feeling better!

Photo of the Day for October 7, 2003 -- Golden Rose urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Someone gave my boss a bouquet at work. I thought the color of this rose quite lovely. I had my camera with me as usual and took a few shots of it before leaving work on Friday. (f/ 8.0, 1.4 sec., ISO 200, +10 close up, UV and warm circular polarizer filters, tabletop tripod mounted, super macro setting on camera, auto bracketing, EV+2/3, office lighting (fluorescent white balance setting), 08:15pm) Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Great shot with lovely colors and detail. Congrats on your win!

Photo of the Day for October 6, 2003 -- Silver Guy in Times Square urlLink Photographer: Margaret A. Satchell Comments: On the street, Manhattan. Camera used: Olympus C4040 Geo. location: New York City Judge's comments: Very cool! The silver guy, the pedestrian, and the background fashion ads all blend together really well. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for October 5, 2003 -- Signs of the Times urlLink Photographer: Dennis Castellano Comments: -- Camera used: Sony Cybershot DSC-F707 Geo. location: Horse Shoe, NC Judge's comments: Great colors and a fun shot of the distant past. Congrats on your win!

Photo of the Day for October 18, 2003 -- Pumpkin Harvest urlLink Photographer: Cheryl Tessens Comments: It is that time of year for Halloween and pumpkins. I could not reist a shot of this. I loved the colors and textures! Camera used: Nikon CP 4500 Geo. location: Holly,MI USA Judge's comments: Great colors and lovely composition. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for October 17, 2003 -- Evening stroll urlLink Photographer: Margaret Satchell Comments: The central park side of the Met. Camera used: Olympus c4040 Geo. location: New York City Judge's comments: Lovely shot! Congrats Margaret.

Photo of the Day for October 16, 2003 -- "Three Straw Men" urlLink Photographer: Dennis Castellano Comments: - Camera used: Sony Cybershot Geo. location: Arden, NC Judge's comments: Halloween.... we don't have that here in the Netherlands. I liked the colors and the atmosphere of the picture. Nice shot.

Photo of the Day for October 15, 2003 -- Autumn's Gold urlLink Photographer: Cheryl Tessens Comments: The late afternoon light on this day was spectacular! I was very glad that I had my camera with me so that I was able to capture what it was that I saw.In this instance this is exactly what my eyes saw! Camera used: Nikon CP 4500 Geo. location: Holly,MI USA Judge's comments: Autumn colors are always lovely. The reflection in the quiet water is great. But what about that little sign on that tree? Something about trespassing?

Photo of the Day for October 14, 2003 -- Park Art urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: I shot this in Rittenhouse Square. I thought the painted picture almost seemed to blend into the background depicted in it. (f/ 2.8, 0.1 sec., ISO 200, program mode (BW), hand held, 05:05pm) Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: I liked this picture a lot. It really takes a second to see what you are looking at. Ah! A painting. Nicely done with the colors like this. A very enjoyable picture!

Photo of the Day for October 13, 2003 -- lotus urlLink Photographer: Louis Hartman Comments: - Camera used: canon d30 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Lovely detail and colors in this great flower. I would have liked to know where this was shot and what your ideas where when you shot this one.

Photo of the Day for October 12, 2003 -- Whew! Long climb! urlLink Photographer: Sherry March Comments: - Camera used: Nikon Coolpix 995 Geo. location: Wellsville, PA Judge's comments: Great detail and good DOF in this one Sherry. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for October 25, 2003 -- Purity of Flight urlLink Photographer: jim carper Comments: A Great Egret sails above the St. Johns River near Mayport, Florida on a blustery Autumn morning. Photo taken October 15, 2003 with my Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the 10d Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: Mayport, Florida Judge's comments: Well, what more can I say. Great shot of a great bird in flight. Congrats Jim.

Photo of the Day for October 24, 2003 -- To the Victor urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: Spotted this group of Pelicans fighting over scraps being tossed by fishermen on shore Camera used: Nikon D 100 Geo. location: Texas City Judge's comments: Great catch! As well for the Pelicans as for you :-)

Photo of the Day for October 23, 2003 -- Japanese Doll Image urlLink Photographer: Calgarey Penn Comments: This photo was taken at an exhibit of Japanese dolls in a gallery in Chicago, Camera was Olympus C5050Z at 1/50 of a second at F 2.6 Camera used: Olympus C5050Z Geo. location: Chicago Judge's comments: Lovely colors and detail on this one.

Photo of the Day for October 22, 2003 -- Room At the Top urlLink Photographer: Paul Michel Comments: Stairs leading to the top of an ancient Indian mound in Cartersville, Georgia USA. B&W, IR, Sepia Toned. Taken on October 18, 2003. Camera used: Canon Powershot G1 Geo. location: Cartersville Judge's comments: Great perspective and lovely colors. Congrats on this POTD.

Photo of the Day for October 21, 2003 -- Terra Cotta urlLink Photographer: Kathy Cunningham Comments: Just some pots at a nursery in Bellevue, WA Camera used: Sony DSC-F717 Geo. location: -- Judge's comments: Just some pots but something you have to 'see' when walking by. Nice shot.

Photo of the Day for October 20, 2003 -- Pastel & Barrels urlLink Photographer: Dennis Castellano Comments: - Camera used: Sony Cybershot Geo. location: Arden, NC Judge's comments: Lovely shot. I like the composition and the idea. I had to look closer to see what I was looking at.

Photo of the Day for October 19, 2003 -- The Sun, the Mountains, and the Weeds urlLink Photographer: Ron Case Comments: I saw this scene as I was driving home Friday night. It was approaching sunset and I liked the way the strong backlighting of the sun highlighted the weeds. I took this shot at an angle to the sun so I could capture some detail in the feathering of the weeds. I was also trying to get the mountains in the background. I ran Color Variations in PE2 to increase the reds and decrease the blues, which more closely represented what I actually saw. No cropping or other processing done. F6.7 aperture, 12.6 focal length, 1/360 sec. exposure Camera used: Kodak DC3400 Geo. location: Wellsville UT Judge's comments: Great shot with lovely detail. I can feel the warmth of the sun here!

Congratulations to Ralph A. Velasco (Photo of the Day winner for 10/26) for winning this month's $50 gift certificate from our generous sponsors, urlLink iPads.com . Photo of the Day for November 1, 2003 -- On Golden Pond urlLink Photographer: Bobbi Hedman Comments: A young man fishing at sunset in Como Park in st. Paul, MN Camera used: Nikon CP5700 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: What a lovely scene! I can hear birds, but also experience the silence of the lake, the water.. Lovely!

Photo of the Day for October 31, 2003 -- Lonestar urlLink Photographer: Kaye Grogan Comments: This is a "starfish" shell that I purchased and I stuck it up in the sand at Myrtle Beach, SC, for this picture. Camera used: Sony DSC-V1 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Lovely shot and great atmosphere. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for October 30, 2003 -- Trouble in Paradise urlLink Photographer: Julia Mazza Comments: This is a fun DA I came up with after watching a tutorial from the CD included with "Digital Photography Techniques" magazine. I took a shot taken on a bright sunny day and via the magic of PS 7, I made it a stormy shot. A bit stylized, but I felt that worked well for a Disney shot! LOL. Camera used: Sony DSC 727 Geo. location: Shot in Orlando, FL Judge's comments: It does work very well. First of all the shot is good and secondly, it was well chosen for this postprocessing work. Well done, great effect.

Photo of the Day for October 29, 2003 -- Empty Lifeguard Chair urlLink Photographer: Kathy Cunningham Comments: Taken in Bellevue, WA. Lighting was not good to show fall colors, however, this little dock and empty chair at a small beach park here without any distracting background caught my eye Camera used: Sony DSC-F717 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Great image. I like the 'emptyness' of the picture.

Photo of the Day for October 28, 2003 -- Mexican Trestle urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: I hiked for 2 hours to get this shot. Up and down woodsy trails in Cloudcroft NM. It was quite a change from the sea level town I live in to the 11,000 foot elevation where this was shot Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Lovely shot Bob. It was worth the hiking!
New from the folks at Shutterline: urlLink Make the Photo of the Day your desktop wallpaper!

Photo of the Day for October 27, 2003 -- Bisectional Reflections urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Distorted reflections of a building in another across from it on Broadway in, near or by Times Square. (f/ 2.8, 0.0125 sec., ISO 200, EB +1/3, warm circular polarizer and UV filters, hand held, 03:15pm) Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: New York City Judge's comments: Great shot with interesting lines. Very good detail.. keeps my eyes busy :-)

Same great Photo of the Day. New, exciting look. I figured we might as well try a new look for the Photo of the Day pages. The other look was getting a little bland. If you like it, urlLink let us know . Negative feedback is also welcome, although we prefer compliments!

Photo of the Day for October 26, 2003 -- Good Morning urlLink Photographer: Ralph A. Velasco Comments: I took this photo a few weeks back on an early Indiana morning. I saw it while driving down the road and like any good photographer I took the time to pull over and take a whole series of shots. Behind me was an equally incredible shot of the full moon setting to the west in the morning light. Camera used: - Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Great shot with a lovely atmosphere. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for November 8, 2003 -- Clouds, Stripes and Distortions urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Distorted reflections in the Stock Exchange Building angled against the Blue Cross Building. (f/ 2.8, 1/2000 sec., ISO 400, 04:45pm) Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Lovely again Robert. You really have an eye for these things.

Photo of the Day for November 7, 2003 -- Chalk It Up urlLink Photographer: Jack Provolt Comments: Artist works on his square during sidewalk art festival in Sacramento, CA, 9/1/03. Camera used: Sony DSC F717 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shot, great angle.

Photo of the Day for November 6, 2003 -- Always Is Not Forever urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: I love these old signs and I thought the sepia look of this one really set it off. This photo just seemed to name itself. I took this photo at an antique village near Houston. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shot. I like the title, detail and colors.

Photo of the Day for November 5, 2003 -- Harrier On the Hunt urlLink Photographer: Lesley Mattuchio Comments: This adult female Northern Harrier was doing her best to scout up a meal. This was taken Oct.31, 2003 and I used my 100-400mm f/4.5-5.6 L IS lens. Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: Parker River Wildlife Refuge, Newburyport, MA. USA Judge's comments: What a great shot of this flying bird. I bet you needed a lot of patience to take this shot. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for November 4, 2003 -- Rainbow Eye urlLink Photographer: Gerda Grice Comments: The "eye" is the wide angle adapter for my Nikon CP 4500. Manual exp.; ISO 100; f/3.5, ss 1/8. I used a couple of filters, including poster edges. Camera used: Nikon CP 4500 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Lovely shot. It makes you wonder what you are looking at :-)

Photo of the Day for November 3, 2003 -- Shallow River urlLink Photographer: Viveca Venegas Comments: This is up river at Schwabachers landing, Jackson Hole Wy. Went on my belly to shoot these pebbles with the cotton woods reflected on the water. Camera used: Sony C707 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shot, lovely colors and detail. Congrats on this lovely scenery.

Photo of the Day for November 2, 2003 -- Blue Angels urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: The stars of the Sea and Sky Spectacular, unfortunately didn't make an appearance until later in the day when the sky had become overcast. Photo taken October 26, 2003 with my Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the 10d. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: Jacksonville Beach, Florida Judge's comments: Great shot. A lot to go wrong taking these.... Sky as well as speed... add that together and you have to do your best. Well done Jim. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for November 15, 2003 -- Fountain of Fun urlLink Photographer: Deborah Walmsley Comments: I had plenty of enjoyment as I watched my little friend, Hunter, show me just how much fun these water fountains can be. He didn't realize how much the temperature had dropped until it was time to leave, and it was then when he felt the cold set in. I must say, he was a real trooper not allowing this to get in the way of stopping for ice cream on our way home. Camera used: Sony DSC-F707 Geo. location: New Playground located in Eagle, Idaho Judge's comments: Lovely shot with a lot of action in it. I like the colors and detail as well. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for November 14, 2003 -- Mini Harvest urlLink Photographer: Dennis Castellano Comments: Camera used: Sony Cybershot Geo. location: Arden, NC Judge's comments: I like the lines on this one and the bright colors.

Photo of the Day for November 13, 2003 -- Falling Leaves in the Park urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Original shot processed in Photo Shop Elements2.0. Separate shots of the park scene and three different images of falling leaves shot in studio. (So what else was I to do with dozens of failed falling leaf shots? I didn't want to delete them all.) Entire image give a light buzz simplifier no. 1. Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Clever idea and well executed.

Photo of the Day for November 12, 2003 -- luggage urlLink Photographer: lou hartman Comments: - Camera used: canon d30 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Makes me want to go on a holiday. Lovely pictures, nice colors and detail.

Photo of the Day for November 11, 2003 -- London Bridge - Arizona urlLink Photographer: Mary Ann Melton Comments: Seeing London Bridge over the Colorado RIver in the middle of the desert is an amazing site. The lampposts are original. Just imagining the effort and organization it took to move this bridge from London to here makes this a true marvel. The lighting at night and the beautiful reflections make it a great place to visit and linger Camera used: Canon EOS D60 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: No comments given on this one by the photographer. That is a pity, because it is always fun to hear the thoughts behind the image. It is a lovely shot. I love the long exposure time although you can see that there was some wind (flag). But it is a great picture.
