Photo of the Day for November 10, 2003 -- Geez, Am I really that fat ? urlLink Photographer: Lyn Winans Comments: Camera used: Olympus E-20 Geo. location: Minden ON Judge's comments: Great shot Lyn. Very funny :-)

Photo of the Day for November 9, 2003 -- Up and Away urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: A Great Egret takes to the air from the waters of the St. Johns River in Mayport, Florida. Photo taken October 14, 2003 with my Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the 10d. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: Mayport, Florida Judge's comments: Well, what more can I say. I imagine Jim sitting next to the water waiting... Yes there is one bird coming.... Click click click. It sounds simple, but it is not. The detail is great. Congrats Jim.

Photo of the Day for November 22, 2003 -- Five Calla urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Five calla lilies arranged and photographed ( F/ 7.0, 1.60 sec., ISO 160, Tripod mounted, warm circular polarizer and UV filters, macro setting, studio lighting, 11:00pm) Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Lovey shot. I like the diagonal lines of the photo and the colors.

Photo of the Day for November 21, 2003 -- "Tat" urlLink Photographer: Lyn Winans Comments: Camera used: Olympus E20 Geo. location: Minden, ON Judge's comments: Lovely picture and well postprocessed. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for November 20, 2003 -- You Light Up My Life urlLink Photographer: Margaret Schmidt Comments: I took this picture and thought it would be a good birthday card for my Mother to give my Father Camera used: Canon 10D Geo. location: Judge's comments: Great shot. Actually Margaret sent in a black and white version with a rather heavy border. This one was submitted earlier and I choose for this one. It is nice and in some sort of pastel colors. Congrats. Lovely shot.

Photo of the Day for November 19, 2003 -- Intruder Alert!! urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: This Great Egret was not at all happy to see someone walking their dog without a leash along the riverbank, and he took to the skies to let everybody within earshot know exactly how he felt. With a brisk wind, he was practically just floating in air while I fired off several shots that I was very happy to get. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: Mayport, Florida Judge's comments: Sigh. Another bird shot..... But what kind of bird shot! What a great shot Jim. The detail and color and the action in this one. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for November 18, 2003 -- Magical World urlLink Photographer: Nathalie Charbonneau Comments: This is a picture of my 2 years old son. He ran before me and I took this incredible shot. Only, the sky was washed out. I replaced it from another sky I had shot a few days earlier and got that stunning surreal feel. Camera used: Nikon CP 5700 Geo. location: Montreal, Canada Judge's comments: What a great montage. You are right, it feels as if your son is about to enter another world. Great effect and well executed. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for November 17, 2003 -- Moving Mountains urlLink Photographer: Bobbi Hedman Comments: This Albino squirrel was taken in my back yard. I have a lot of grey squirrels invading my bird feeders, but this morning was the first time I saw the albino - they are not very common in this area (St. Paul, MN) Camera used: Canon EOS Rebel DSLR Geo. location: Judge's comments: Great shot and what a spectacular animal. Never seen one before. You almost can't miss that one in the garden!

Photo of the Day for November 16, 2003 -- Grandpa's Store Front urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: I decided to see how this photo of an antique village would look as a pencil drawing. Hope you like it Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City Judge's comments: Great Idea Bob and well executed. I guess the 'real' photo is also very nice. Congrats on your win today.

Photo of the Day for November 29, 2003 -- Apricot Silk urlLink Photographer: Blake Heminger Comments: Camera used: Nikon CP5700 Geo. location: Foster City, CA Judge's comments: A lovely shot with great detail. Really soft looking. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for November 28, 2003 -- A Golden Morning urlLink Photographer: Terry Cervi Comments: This image was taken in Bandon Beach, Oregon, while my hubby and I were vacationing in late September Camera used: Canon EF 17-40mm, 1/90, f5.6 ISO100 Geo. location: Oregon Judge's comments: What a great picture. Lovely colors and detail and great atmosphere

Photo of the Day for November 27, 2003 -- Happy Thanksgiving urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, Pa Judge's comments: To be honest... I wanted to move this one to my 'not' directory, because I have such a lovely pheasant nearby that I sometimes photograph. And now there is some sort of animal standing there.. ready to be eaten. But hey! It is a stuffed animal so..... Great idea and very nice colors :-)

Photo of the Day for November 26, 2003 -- Play that funky music white boy! urlLink Photographer: Julia Mazza Comments: His parents wanted a shot of him playing his guitar. He got a bit silly. I loved this particular shot for his expression. He was really into it and really playing that guitar. Since we may now submit photos of children, I couldn't wait to submit this one! Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: Clearwater, FL Judge's comments: Great shot with a lovely expression.

Photo of the Day for November 25, 2003 -- Stormclouds at Whispering Sands urlLink Photographer: Bob Jones Comments: Near Dusk. with a Sigma 17 - 35mm lens @17mm: 3sec @f22 Singh-Ray Blue/Gold and Cokin Grey Grad 0.6 Filters Camera used: Canon Eos D60 Geo. location: North Wales UK Judge's comments: Wonderful image with excellent colors. I can hear the sea and feel the breeze on my face. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for November 24, 2003 -- I'm Watching You urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: This beautiful Brown Pelican all decked out in his courting feathers, never took he eyes off of me as I eased down the pier to get a better view. With this view you can see how the Brown Pelican grows a silver back and a bright yellow crown when it wants to mate. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City Judge's comments: Great shot Bob. Lovely colors and detail.

Photo of the Day for November 23, 2003 -- Peeking Back urlLink Photographer: Terry Cervi Comments: My settings were 1/250, f8.0, ISO400. I was lucky to get a shot of this Beluga whale as he was blowing bubbles and peeking back at me Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: Judge's comments: Well, what is there to say? I like the colors, the detail and most of all the moment you captured with this shot. That eye looking at you and the smile on his face. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for December, 6, 2003 -- Sunset Distortions II urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Well the problems with my older computer go on and I have no access to about a billion pictures until I can get some sort of connect, CD-R or network connection to work. So I went out to get some cityscape pics last weekend and this is one of them. A portion of Liberty Place I with golden distorted reflections of 1700 Market Street. (f/ 3.2, 1/40 sec., EB -1/3, ISO 160, hand held, 04:15pm) Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Great picture. I love the diagonal lines as well as the colors.

Photo of the Day for December 5, 2003 -- ElectroGlide urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: Several pelicans were sitting around this morning, picking off fish as they swam by, and this fellow was making a pass back to his perching spot after a quick snack. Photo taken December 4, 2003 with my Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the 10d. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: Mayport, Florida Judge's comments: What a great shot. I like the way he almost touched the water with his wing. The space at the right side of the bird is also great, it leaves him some space to fly to. Great detail and color Jim.

Photo of the Day for December 4, 2003 -- Pink Passion urlLink Photographer: Margaret Schmidt Comments: I've just been playing with my software, and finally got a chance to take a few photo's Camera used: Canon D60 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shot and good postprocessing.

Photo of the Day for December 3, 2003 -- I Hear a Mockingbird Singing urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: This little fellow let me get so close I had to back off on the zoom Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas city, Texas Judge's comments: Lovely bird picture Bob and great detail.

Photo of the Day for December 2, 2003 -- Park Bench urlLink Photographer: Margaret Satchell Comments: Taken in Central Park during a rain shower--I was struck by the lovely shape of these benches. Camera used: Olympus c4040 Geo. location: New York City Judge's comments: What is there to say. I like the dramatic black and white colors and the curves. Excellent angle you have chosen for this one. Well seen and captured.

Photo of the Day for December 1, 2003 -- A Furtive Glance urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: Visiting family for Thanksgiving in Georgia, so no birding opportunities over the last few days, so here's a shot I took of my daughter wearing one of my hats, and it's quite obvious, I think, that she's as photogenic as any bird one might come across anyway. :^) Photo taken November 28, 2003 with my Canon 28-135mm lens attached to the 10d. Camera used: Canon 10D Geo. location: Lake Park, Georgia Judge's comments: Great shot. If I would be super critical, I might have chosen for one 'whole' eye and the other covered by the hat. But there is enough light in the eye. The sun on the hair is also very nice, gives a 'warm' effect. The diagonal line in the picture is very pleasing.

Photo of the Day for November 30, 2003 -- Old Harper's Mill urlLink Photographer: Julia Mazza Comments: This is a fabricated mill at Disney World, Magic Kingdom, in Frontier Land. I decided to go for the sepia tone and add a bit of grain to enhance the "age" of the image. I love antiques and this shot made me think of things old and long forgotten. Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: Orlando, FL Judge's comments: Lovely atmosphere. I think the sepia is well chosen and the extra grain makes it look a little older. Well done. Congrats. The fact that the lines are not really straight is not a real problem in this picture, since it is old :-) I like the angle from where you shoot from, maybe I would have left a little more space on the right?

Photo of the Day for December 13, 2003 -- Christmas at Tiffany's urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: The holidays at the Tiffany and Company store as shown in one of their three windows on Walnut Street. Thank goodness the change displays at least once a month or would never have anything to shoot on my way home from work at night. (f/ 2.8, 1/20 sec., EB + 1/3, ISO 160, warm circular polarizer and UV filters, camera mounted on table top tripod against me steadied by my elbow on the building wall by the window, 09:11pm) Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Lovely atmosphere and colors.

Photo of the Day for December 12, 2003 -- Let It Snow ! urlLink Photographer: Margaret Schmidt Comments: This one knows that alone with the snow comes Santa Camera used: Canon 10D Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely picture, not much to be said. You captured the happiness of the child very well.

Photo of the Day for December 11, 2003 -- Humming Bird Song urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: Humming Birds and DA. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely postprocessing. I bet the shot of the hummingbird is also great! Congrats!

Photo of the Day for December 10, 2003 -- Diminishing Line urlLink Photographer: Bob Jones Comments: Pre Dawn taken with a 20 seconds exposure @ f27 using a Singh-Ray Blue/Gold filter @ 17mm Camera used: Canon Eos D60 Geo. location: North Wales Judge's comments: Great picture and lovely scenery. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for December 9, 2003 -- Bouncing in Color! urlLink Photographer: Sam Blankenship Comments: This is picture of my granddaughter taken at her Birthday party in one of the bounce playhouses Camera used: Nikon Coolpix 990 Geo. location: Judge's comments: This picture made me smile. I liked the expression of the girl and the colors. The fact that there is another child in the background makes is more clear that those chidren where playing just before you wanted to take the picture. Well.. anyway, that is my story when I look at the picture. I even hear the girl ......

Photo of the Day for December 8, 2003 -- Oregon Autumn urlLink Photographer: Terry Cervi Comments: This image was taken while my husband and I traveled to Oregon in September. We had just exited the Oregon Caves and began walking down the long pathway to the lodge when these two beautiful deer came wandering along, grazing on the grass and leaves. They didn't seem too startled and didn't run but the lighting wasn't great and I didn't have my tripod so I was disappointed when I discovered the one deer's head was slightly oof. I used the buzz filter and it helped save my photo Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shot Terry.

Photo of the Day for December 7, 2003 -- Are We Having Fun Yet urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: This was taken on recent visit to Disney and SeaWorld in Orlando... Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: Orlando, Florida Judge's comments: I hope you all agree with me that this is a great shot. You can almost hear the screaming of those people having fun, and the sound of the water and the boat. Really lovely.

Photo of the Day for December 20, 2003 -- Young Girl of the Masai Tribe urlLink Photographer: Bob Jones Comments: North Wales UK Camera used: Canon Eos 10D Geo. location: A girl in a team of dancers from Kenya competing in this years International Eisteddfod held in Llangollen North Wales each July Judge's comments: I would have believed it if you would have said that you were in Kenia. I like the colors very much as well as the detail and composition of the picture. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for December 19, 2003 -- Christmas on the City Square urlLink Photographer: Ron Case Comments: Each year our town places several Christmas displays on the City Square. I especially like this one because it shows the historic Tabernacle in the background. The building is no longer used for worship services but remains a highly visible landmark in our community Camera used: Minolta Dimage A1 Geo. location: Wellsville UT Judge's comments: I think it is a lovely shot, with theTabernacle in the background. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for December 18, 2003 -- Christmas on the River urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: Reflections of the St. Johns River, and downtown Jacksonville, in an ornament on a Christmas tree at "The Landing." Photo taken the evening of December 12, 2003 with my Canon 28-135mm lens attached to the 10d. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: Jacksonville, Florida Judge's comments: I was surprised to see that this image belonged to Jim. I am so used to his excellent bird shots! But I found the image on the ball very attractive. A nice combination. Also great that the photographer is not visible (not that I would not want to see Jim, but on some images you see 'unwanted' reflections). You should click for the larger image, so that you can see the reflection of the river.

Photo of the Day for December 17, 2003 -- Classic Beauty urlLink Photographer: Blake Heminger Comments: A rose called Classic Beauty Camera used: Nikon CP5700 Geo. location: Foster City, CA Judge's comments: Lovely rose shot!

Photo of the Day for December 16, 2003 -- Gorillas Are like Onions.... urlLink Photographer: jim carper Comments: If you're a fan of "Shrek" you know the meaning of the title, and if you aren't....then SHAME on you! :^) Photo taken at the Jacksonville, Florida, Zoo on December 9, 2003 with my Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the 10d. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: Jacksonville, Florida Judge's comments: Nope, don't know it, but I do know that I like the expression of the gorilla and the detail that you captured.

Photo of the Day for December 15, 2003 -- Sunrise Over Llanwrst urlLink Photographer: Bob Jones Comments: Taken on a ridge high above the valley at sunrise on a beautiful winter's day Camera used: Canon Eos D60 Geo. location: North Wales in the UK Judge's comments: Lovely image and great colors.

Photo of the Day for December 14, 2003 -- Autumn Golf urlLink Photographer: Lyn Winans Comments: Camera used: Olympus E20 Geo. location: Minden, ON Judge's comments: Lovely colors and detail on this one. Congrats Lyn!

Photo of the Day for December 27, 2003 -- Harvests End urlLink Photographer: Bob Jones Comments: Taken on a Moody morning in August in between rain showers Camera used: Canon Eos D60 Geo. location: North Wales UK Judge's comments: Lovely dramatic scene with lovely color.

Photo of the Day for December 26, 2003 -- Careless Love urlLink Photographer: Blake Heminger Comments: This is a rose called "Careless Love" Camera used: Nikon CP880 Geo. location: Foster City, CA Judge's comments: Great colors and beautiful detail. Congrats!
December 25, 2003 -- Silent Night urlLink I want to wish all Shutterliners a merry X-mas! I hope that all of you have a great day today with many friends, love and warmth around! Mariette

Photo of the Day for December 24, 2003 -- Look what Santa left! urlLink Photographer: Julia Mazza Comments: This precious little gift from last year is no longer tiny, but fills our hearts to overflowing with love! My kids would agree that this was their best gift from Santa, ever! Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: Clearwater, FL Judge's comments: This made me smile!

Photo of the Day for December 23, 2003 -- Egged urlLink Photographer: Kevin S Dahlen Comments: My Son getting Egg on his Face! Taylor really liked how this came out. Camera used: Olympus E-20 Geo. location: Fontana, California Judge's comments: I really had to look at this to see what I was looking at. Great catch, it made me smile.

Photo of the Day for December 22, 2003 -- Mirror Mirror urlLink Photographer: Margaret Satchell Comments: Inside an art installation at the Mattress Factory in Pittsburgh. Camera used: Olympus c4040 Geo. location: Judge's comments: That is indeed creative. Great capture and nice colors. It really keep the eye busy!

Photo of the Day for December 21, 2003 -- Bee Cool urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: Honey Bee covered in pollen walking on a Wax Ligustrum Camera used: Nikon D-100 Geo. location: Texas City, Texas Judge's comments: Lovely shot of this tiny creature.

Photo of the Day for January 3, 2004 -- Soap Bubbles urlLink Photographer: Blake Heminger Comments: Dish soap bubbles on the side of the glass jar. Camera used: Nikon CP5700 Geo. location: Foster City, CA Judge's comments: Lovely detail and great idea.

Photo of the Day for January 2, 2004 -- Ford urlLink Photographer: Bobbi Hedman Comments: Old Ford seen at an auto show in St. Paul, MN Camera used: Nikon CP5700 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely detail and composition

Photo of the Day for January 1, 2004 -- Happy 2004 urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: Happy New Year Everyone! Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City, Texas Judge's comments: I wish everyone also the best for 2004 and I am looking forward seeing your pictures all over the web in 2004!

Photo of the Day for December 31, 2003 -- dawn fisher urlLink Photographer: Margaret Satchell Comments: A brief description of the photograph. early morning on the bay side of captiva island Camera used: Olympus c4040 Geo. location: Captiva, Florida Judge's comments: Lovely atmosphere and great capture. I wish everyone a safe and happy New Year's Eve

Photo of the Day for December 30, 2003 -- Get Me The Penske File ! urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: My pal, Lash, talking on the "phone" at the Jacksonville, Florida, Zoo. Photo taken December > 29, 2003 with my Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the 10d. Camera used: Canon 10D Geo. location: Jacksonville, Florida Judge's comments: Lovely Jim, I also made a story around the image. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for December 29, 2003 -- Bah Hum Bug urlLink Photographer: William E Davis Jr Comments: This is a photo of our dog Scooby who seems to be sad for it is the holiday season and no one is giving him the attention he needs because we are all busy Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Poor doggy. At first I thought he had a hangover :-) Lovely expression and well chosen angle to shoot from. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for December 28, 2003 -- Regal Fritillary urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: Close up of a Gulf Fritillary Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City, Texas Judge's comments: Lovely close up, makes me long for summertimes again. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for January 10, 2004 -- The Falls in Winter urlLink Photographer: Terry Cervi Comments: I drove to Niagara Falls today even though the temperature was only 2 degrees. I spent two hours walking (and sliding) around the park. It was amazingly beautiful with the trees were covered with thick coats of ice. The parking lot, walkways and even the grassy areas were coated with ice too and it was extremely difficult to walk without falling. I was interviewed by a newspaper reporter who was doing a report about why people were out at the park on such a bitter cold day Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: Judge's comments: Great shot with lovely colors. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for January 9, 2004 -- Homeless in Shadows of Family urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: I took a walk at lunch today thinking I would try to get to a church that I can see in the distance from my office. I never quite got there. Along the Parkway, there are two statues of families. I shot one and when looking for a title or artist information around the back of the statue, I saw someone come out from under a quilt along the wall behind the statue. I did not want to disturb the person or anyone else as there were other bundles of quilts along the wall there so I went to the the other statue. I think they are positioned there so they cannot be seen from the street by passing police. I had to take the picture and I hope it came out OK but I couldn't take anymore immediately afterwards. I just was not in the mood. I like the poignancy of the picture of the shadows of the family in the statue on the wall by the bundle of a person....they seem to be be protecting or keeping watch over him or her. (f/ 3.2, 1/125 sec., EB + 1/3, ISO 160, warm circular polarizer and UV filters, hand held, 04:11 pm) Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Great shot. Congrats on the 'two in a row'. That can happen because I just look at the pictures and search for the photographer afterwards. I also liked the combination of the shadows and the person on the left. It makes you wonder.

Photo of the Day for January 8, 2004 -- Peacock Eye urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: The tail feather for a peacock ornament I bought for my sister for Christmas. (f/ 10.1, 2.46 seconds, ISO 160, warm circular polarizer and UV filters, tripod mounted, 'Studio Lighting', 09:29pm) Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Lovely detail and colors on this one Robert. Congrats!
Photo of the Day for January 7, 2004 -- Heceta Head Lighthouse urlLink Photographer: Terry Cervi Comments: Camera used: Canon 10D Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely scenery. Congrats

Photo of the Day for Januray 6, 2004 -- Nuisance urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: This cat is famous on the Galveston Strand for surviving being trapped in 2 house fires. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City, Texas Judge's comments: Poor cat, but it is still white anyway! Lovely shot with great detail.

Photo of the Day for January 5, 2004 -- Slip of the Tongue urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: I'm always struck by how well groomed the two male lions are at the Jacksonville Zoo......they always look like someone has just finished giving their manes a good brushing. Photo taken December 29, 2003 with my Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the 10d. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: Jacksonville, Florida Judge's comments: I bet this lion just ate one of Jim's birds. Great shot, lovely detail and you are right! Looks as if he just got his hair done

Photo of the Day for January 4, 2004 -- Lake Effect urlLink Photographer: Terry Cervi Comments: During "Lake Effect" snow storms in the Buffalo, NY area, it can be sunny and snowing at the same time. This was taken at Niagara Falls, NY. Camera used: Minolta Dimage 7i Geo. location: Niagara Falls, NY Judge's comments: Lovely picture. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for January 17, 2004 -- Moon Over Egret Bay urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: This Egret was standing on a fishing pier. The bird was very sharp but, the back ground was boring so... I did a little DA work. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City Judge's comments: Yes, I like it. The Egret is great and I can imagine that something like this could be seen in nature as well. Well executed DA work Bob.

Photo of the Day for January 16, 2004 -- Fun in the Snow urlLink Photographer: Terry Cervi Comments: This is my brother's little 1 year old Snoodle, Morgan, having a great time in the snow on Christmas Day. Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shot. It made me smile

Photo of the Day for January 15, 2004 -- Mirror Drops Pink urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: I wanted to do a new reflective drop shot. Based on what I had read, I had bought some RainX to use to treat the glass so that the water drops bead up nicely. Then I got lazy and thought my lighting wound not be any good so I let it go. I was cruising the picture sights and saw that everyone seemed to be doing the standard drop reflection through a piece of glass and over some object. I had to think of something different so I came up with this idea. I treated a mirror with RainX (by the way....the stuff works GREAT!!!) and set it on my black velvet. I set the gerbera daisy over the mirror...it was place on a higher lever so that most of the daisy was standing on and above the mirror and not directly on it. I used any eye dropper to place some beads of water on a diagonal from the daisy. The shot was lit with a single clamp lamp with a 60 watt Reveal light bulb at the corner of the diagonal of the beads of water on the mirror. I had some problems with errant light reflections but they were expunged from the image in post processing. Later shots of the several series I took have not lights in the image but a lot of noise developed because of the low lighting used. I experiement some with the light and found that a sheet of black poster board place over the light got rid of the errant reflections. That's about it.....hope you like it! (f/ 11.3, 1.7 seconds, EB + 2/3, ISO 160, tripod mounted, 1x, 2x, 4x and 10x closeup filters on camera in super macro mode, 12:23am) Camera used: Fuji FP S 602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: well.. here is one of robert's lessons again. I think it is great that you not only share your lovely pictures with us, but also are kind enough to share your knowlegde with us. congrats on a lovely picture.

Photo of the Day for January 14, 2004 -- Morning Light on the Straits urlLink Photographer: Bob Jones Comments: Taken on a dull morning in April with filtered sunlight streaming across the mountains over the Menai Straits. Camera used: Canon EOS D60 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely colors and great atmosphere. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for January 13, 2004 -- Wasp urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: I was shooting some flower photos when this fellow flew into the picture Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas City, Texas Judge's comments: Great detail. Congrats Bob.

Photo of the Day for January 12, 2004 -- Tracks urlLink Photographer: Lisa Haskins Comments: Amsterdam, on the tram tracks Camera used: Canon 10D Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely detail and atmosphere in this picture.

Photo of the Day for January 11, 2004 -- Go Miami urlLink Photographer: Margaret Schmidt Comments: Camera used: Canon 10D Geo. location: This is a photo of a friend that ask if I could shoot them in their football gear for their sports room, this is what I finished up with Judge's comments: Very nice shot, great color, detail and composition. I bet they were happy with the result.

Photo of the Day for January 24, 2004 -- Promised For Tomorrow urlLink Photographer: Bonnie Lackey Comments: Carnation bud backed by Fuji mums Camera used: Nikon Coolpix 5000 Geo. location: Sleepy Hollow, IL Judge's comments: I like this picture a lot. The idea of the bud against the flower in full is very attractive.

Photo of the Day for January 23, 2004 -- Ha, That's A Good One Fred urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: I missed the joke but, caught the reaction Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas Judge's comments: Lovely shot with lively colors and great detail in the birds.

Photo of the Day for January 22, 2004 -- Van Pelt Street urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: One of my favorite little streets in the city. I took this on a dreary rainy winter's Sunday. I did not like how the sky turned out so I re-colored it and applied the Buzz Simplifier no. 1 to the image and framed it. Camera used: Fuji FInePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Lovely colors and good postprocessing.

Photo of the Day for January 2, 2004 -- Cardinal Bracing Against the Snow Storm urlLink Photographer: Drake Olmstead Comments: Camera used: Camera: Nikon D100, Taken in Battle Creek, Mi on 1-17-04, F5.3, 1/40 sec, Nikon 80-400 MM VR AF lens. Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shot. The expresion, the colors. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for January 20, 2004 -- Hey...Izzat t'ing Got A Hemi? urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: A couple of Brown Pelicans re-enacting the popular Chrysler SUV ads. Photo taken with Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the 10d. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: Mayport, Florida Judge's comments: Great shot, really special that there were two birds on the image, one in action, the other one nice vague on the background. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for January 19, 2004 -- A Summers Breeze urlLink Photographer: Margaret Schmidt Comments: I'm not sure if all the shots in this were done with the G3, I think I might have one from my Canon A20, but it was edited and fixed with Photoshop and FX, I love this shore scene and was playing with it trying to learn my software, real fun stuff but not real easy for me to learn :( Camera used: Canon G2/ FX dream software and Photoshop 7 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shots added together in this lovely image. Well done and congrats!

Photo of the Day for January 18, 2004 -- Mirrored Autumn urlLink Photographer: Sherry March Comments: Camera used: Nikon Coolpix 995 Geo. location: Wellsville, PA Judge's comments: Lovely lighting and colors on this one!

Photo of the Day for January 31, 2004 -- Allons-y (girl in Paris Metro) urlLink Photographer: Margaret Satchell Comments: I was enchanted by this metro station which was tiled with letters like one of those word-find puzzles...and in fact there were words embedded in there! This woman with yellow shoes was walking (briskly) down the opposite platform--her motion blur was quite by accident as a result of the low lighting and longish shutter speed. Camera used: Olympus c4040 Geo. location: Paris Judge's comments: You are honest with your remark about the motion, but that is exactly what I liked in this picture. The static letters and the moving girl. Congrats

Photo of the Day for January 30, 2004 -- The RedHead urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: Lash shows off his his handsome shock of red hair, as well as his big ol' melon head. Photo taken October 2, 2003 with my Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the D30. Camera used: Canon EOS D30 Geo. location: Jacksonville, Florida Judge's comments: Lovely expression on this huge animal. Congrats Jim.

Photo of the Day for January 29, 2004 -- Tulips urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: was experimenting with 'Painting with Light' for some challenge somewhere else. I waved 3 brands of small Christmas tree lights over the bouquet during the long exposure. I was not happy with what I got so I did some normal processing (adjustment layers of levels, Brightness/congrast, hue and saturation.....unsharp mask) and ran the picture through NeatImage and then gave it a big dose of the Buzz simplifier no. 1. (f/ 11.0, 15 seconds, ISO-160, tripod mounted, 11:30 PM) Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Lovely colors and well executed DA.

Photo of the Day for January 28, 2004 -- Take Me Out To The Ball Game urlLink Photographer: Margaret Schmidt Comments: This little guy is intent in getting to the little box of cheereo's in the center of the glove. I thought this would look good as an old photo that's why I used the golden tones. Camera used: Canon 10D Geo. location: Judge's comments: I like the atmosphere on this one and the huge ball due to the perspective and the angle. Small boy and large ball ;-0 It made me smile.

Photo of the Day for January 27, 2004 -- Winter Tranquillity urlLink Photographer: Terry Cervi Comments: I was the only person in the park this particular morning, after a beautiful snowfall Camera used: Nikon CP990 Geo. location: Glen Falls Park Judge's comments: Lovely image with a wonderful accent. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for January 26, 2004 -- Tunnel Vision urlLink Photographer: Paul Michel Comments: This is a walkway connecting two buildings in down town Atlanta. Taken 1-24-04. Camera used: Canon EOS Digital Rebel Geo. location: Judge's comments: Well seen. The colors are well chosen I think, because colors might distract the eye too much from the tunnel itself.

Photo of the Day for January 25, 2004 -- Hush, don't wake baby! urlLink Photographer: Julia Mazza Comments: This little darling is 2 weeks old and yes the dog is real. She wanted to see the baby. This is a friend's baby and I was up at her home taking portraits and this was one of my favorites. Loved her antique carriage! Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: Clearwater, FL Judge's comments: Lovely colors and nice atmosphere.

Photo of the Day for February 7, 2004 -- Softly Softly II urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Comments: Flowers planted inside a building at work. Converted to b&w and softfocus filter applied in PSP8. Camera used: Pentax Optio 555 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: Lovely image. Don't know, but it is quite attarctive. I like the softness, but despite the softness the flowers are clear and detailed. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for February 6, 2004 -- Mirror Drops Gold urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: This was from the last series of the first group of shots I took. I was able to barely light the drops and the spare lighting made it bit more interesting. No errant light to remove at all but very noisy. (f/ 11.3, 8 seconds, EB +2/3, ISO-160, +1, +2, +4 and +10 close up filters on camera in super macro mode, tripod mounted, studio lighting, 12:57 AM) Camera used: Fuji FInePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: what more can I say. lovely shot!

Photo of the Day for February 5, 2004 -- Latin Gypsy Curiosa urlLink Photographer: Blake Heminger Comments: A "Macro" shot of one of my roses called Latin Gypsy Curiosa. This rose is a light yellow to orange in color. This photo was taken at approximately 11:00 am. I choose Black and White to bring out the shadows. Camera used: Nikon CP880 Geo. location: Foster City, CA Judge's comments: Lovely rose shot and I bet it is great in color too. Congrats Blake.

Photo of the Day for February 4, 2004 -- It's mine! It's mine! urlLink Photographer: Gary J. Will Comments: Unfortunately this was an image that was overexposed due to the whiteness of the birds. But, the timing makes up for it. I was watching people feed the birds and with my Canon 100-400 L IS lens caught the piece of bread being tossed up just before it was gobbled up in mid-air. Camera used: Canon EOS Digital Rebel Geo. location: Salem, OR Judge's comments: I still like this capture of the birds, 'fighting' for the bread. Well seen.

Photo of the Day for February 3, 2004 -- At the Corner of Center and Main in Small Town America urlLink Photographer: Ron Case Comments: I like the irony of the modern street sign and the absolute 'nothingness' of anything at the intersection. I applied the 'Hayes Island Technique' action in Photo Shop to dress it up a little bit. Camera used: Kodak DC3400 Geo. location: Wellsville Utah Judge's comments: I see what you mean Ron. Well seen and nice DA.

Photo of the Day for February 2, 2004 -- "Pal" urlLink Photographer: Lynn Winans Comments: Camera used: Olympus E-1 Geo. location: Minden, ON Judge's comments: Lovely colors and a lot to be seen on this one.

Photo of the Day for February 1, 2004 -- Hyde Street Trolly urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: Took this shot in San Francisco. I thought the effect just fit the photo. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: San Francisco Judge's comments: Nice effect. But I think that the original looks great as well. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for February 14, 2004 -- The Heart of America urlLink Photographer: Kaye Grogan Comments: Bubbles have been added from the "particle" effect in PhotoImpact. Camera used: Sony DSC-V1 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Thought this would be a good Valentine shot for today. Like the colors and the idea.

Photo of the Day for February 13, 2004 -- Handmade Marbles urlLink Photographer: Kathy Cunningham Comments: Closeup of new handmade marbles. Used natural light and cropped and made slight adjustments for color and contrast with PhotoShop7. Camera used: Sony DSC-F717 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely image with great detail and colors. Also like the marbles !

Photo of the Day for February 12, 2003 -- Top Dog urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: Next time you are in San Francisco, get some earplugs, hold your nose and go down to pier 39 for some great shots of the Sea Lions. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shot with good detail. Strange to see all those sea lions on top of eachother!
Photo of the Day for February 11, 2004 -- Tulips urlLink Photographer: lou hartman Comments: Camera used: canon 300 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Nicely executed and bright and attractive colors.

Photo of the Day for February 10, 2004 -- Needs Work urlLink Photographer: Edgar Kitson Southward Comments: This old short bed farm truck has been sitting in the side yard of a home in Pahrump, Nevada for at leas the ten years I've lived here. I just could not pass up the opportunity to take its picture for submission. Camera used: Panasonic Lumix FZ10 Geo. location: - Judge's comments: Lovely image, a lot to be seen on this one... keeps the eye busy :-) Congrats.

Photo of the Day for February 9, 2004 -- Pelican urlLink Photographer: Kay Prather Comments: This pelican showed up on my wharf, I think it had it eye on some bait fish before its eye was on me..I got off a few shots before it slid into the water and swam away Camera used: Nikon Cp 995 Geo. location: South, La Judge's comments: Lovely detail and expression on this bird. Maybe for a next time, try to get some more space below and above the bird. Give it a little more space and try to capture the whole shadow and see if that works out even better. Congrats on this pic.

Photo of the Day for February 8, 2004 -- Heart Pounding Ride urlLink Photographer: Gary J. Will Comments: This was shot on Wednesday the 28th of January. It was a beautiful day with medium to high surf on Sunset Beach. I used my Canon 100-400 L IS lens hand-held on shore to catch this and other action taking place more than a quarter of a mile out. When you consider that with the digital, the 400 mm is equal to a 640 mm on a 35 mm body hand-held, I have a lot of respect for this lens. Camera used: Canon EOS Digital Rebel Geo. location: Sunset Beach, Oahu, Hawaii Judge's comments: Lovely action shot. I can almost hear the waves and the sea. Wish I was there!

Photo of the Day for February 21, 2004 -- Diminishing Line urlLink Photographer: Bob Jones Comments: Shoreline Image taken at Dawn of the Storm Breakers on a North Wales Beach Camera used: Canon Eos D60 Sigma 28 - 70 @34mm: 30seconds @f22 with Singh-Ray Filter Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shot, lovely colors and great atmosphere. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for February 20, 2004 -- The Boss urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: White Pelican sunning on a cool day. Shot on the Texas City dike. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely detail and colors. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for February 19, 2004 -- Macon Arches urlLink Photographer: Sherry March Comments: Camera used: Nikon Coolpix 995 Geo. location: Wellsville, PA Judge's comments: Lovely image and quite a lot to be seen on this one. The depth of the image takes your eye right through to the back.

Photo of the Day for February 18, 2004 -- Wish upon a star urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Comments: A star-shaped slinky that I've always wanted to take a photo of ... Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: Lovely shot. I can imagine that this is a nice object to photograph! Well done.

Photo of the Day for February 17, 2004 -- Tulipa tude urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Not sure of the name of the tulip but I found a tulip similar to it on Flower Base and I thought it appropos, n'est-e pas? (f/ 11.0, 0.77 sec., ISO-200, Studio Lighting, Tripod Mounted, +10,+4, +2 and +1, Close Filters, Super Macro Mode, 09:57 PM) Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: No Robert, it is not an tude, but a Tulipa Robert. Great shot, makes you look twice. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for February 16, 2004 -- Nature's Finger-painting urlLink Photographer: Gary J Will Comments: This is the bark of a gum tree photographed last Monday with a Canon 50mm Macro at the Wahiawa Botanical Gardens, Hawaii. Camera used: Canon EOS Digital Rebel Geo. location: Wahiawa, HI Judge's comments: Well seen. I really had to look at this picture and was wondering what I saw exactly. Nice detail and colors.

Photo of the Day for February 15, 2004 -- Stacked urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Comments: Just a bunch of white bowls I have Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: Great shot, lovely pure white on white. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for February 28, 2004 -- Barnyard Art urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: This barnyard just cried out for a little art work! Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas Judge's comments: Nice postprocessing on this one, but I think that the original is also very attractive! Congrats Bob.

Photo of the Day for February 27, 3004 -- A Little Mardi Gras urlLink Photographer: Kay Prather Comments: A little color, bangle, beads and mask from a South, La holiday.. Camera used: Nikon Cp 995 Geo. location: South, La Judge's comments: Lovely colors and a lot to be seen on this one.

Photo of the Day for February 26, 2004 -- Circles of Light urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Comments: Taken at the airport in Las Vegas, Nevada. Some sort of high-tech looking ceiling lamp that attracted my attention :) Camera used: Pentax Optio 555 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: I can imagine that it attracted your attention! I think it is a shot where people have to look at twice. I realyl like the lines and the detail in this one. Congrats.
Photo of the Day for February 25, 2004 -- "Cool One" urlLink Photographer: Lyn Winans Comments: Camera used: E1 Geo. location: Minden, ON Judge's comments: Lovely image!

Photo of the Day for February 24, 2004 -- Good Morning ! urlLink Photographer: Terry Cervi Comments: Taken at Bandon Beach in Oregon Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: Judge's comments: What can I say. Lovely colors, lovely image and well chosen angle. I can hear the sea and the birds above my head here. And... I can feel the morning sun on my skin. Congrats on this lovely image.

Photo of the Day for February 23, 2004 -- Greenie urlLink Photographer: Jim carper Comments: A Little Green Heron shows off the small patch of green coloring on his back that gives him his name. Photo taken January 22, 2004 using my Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the 10d. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: Jacksonville, Florida Judge's comments: Lovely image, very nice colors.

Photo of the Day for February 22, 2004 -- Bars and Shadows urlLink Photographer: Gerda Grice Comments: I took this back in December in Cozumel, Mexico. I loved the bright colours and the deep shadows from the afternoon sun. Camera used: Minolta DiMage A1 Aperture priority l ISO 100; ss 1/2500, f/3.5. Haze filter only. Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shot and well seen.

Photo of the Day for March 6, 2004 -- Gerbera and Anemone urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: This was lit with a 100w halogen bulb in a clamp lamp through a Photoflex translucent lite disc. Another lite disc with a reflective covering was placed on the opposite side. Normal processing, neat image, USM, Buzz, USM framed resized and usm. (f/11.3, 6.06 seconds, EB +1/3, ISO-200, tripod mounted, studio lighting, 12:36 AM) Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Sorry about this... three flower shots in a row. But I think this is another shot that is remarkable for the colors. Congratulations.

Photo of the Day for March 5, 2004 -- Global Warming Cactus Tulip urlLink Photographer: Bonnie Lackey Comments: Using Picture It! effects on an ordinary tulip, I ended up with this strangely appealing image. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Sleepy Hollow, IL Judge's comments: Here is another tulip picture. I think it is quite attractive, although it looks a bit strange on first sight. Makes it some sort of abstract. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for March 4, 2004 -- TULIPS urlLink Photographer: Louis Hartman Comments: Camera used: Canon 300 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely image. I like the softness and the mystical atmosphere of this one.

Photo of the Day for March 3, 2004 -- On the Banks urlLink Photographer: Bobbi Hedman Comments: Bald Eagle in the wild. Taken at Reads Landing, MN Camera used: Cabon Rebel Geo. location: Taken at Reads Landing, MN Judge's comments: Lovely bird shot!

Photo of the Day for March 2, 2004 -- Traveller urlLink Photographer: Lyn Winans Comments: Camera used: E-1 Geo. location: Minden Judge's comments: Congrats Lyn. Normally it is a bit strange to photograph an animal 'behind bars', but this is very nicely done. the nose and the eyes.. you can almost feel the thrill of the dog to get out!

Photo of the Day for March 1, 2004 -- Refresh urlLink Photographer: Dennis Preston Comments: Ahh!! A photo for all the Coca Cola lovers. Taken in Kalispell Mt. by the Old Steel Bridge. The Rocky Mountains are in the background, Flathead River in the foreground. Post processing,applied Paint Shop Pro one step photo fix and resized. I took this shot on my birthday (Jan 1) while learning to work with my christmas gift from my wife Camera used: Canon Powershot A70 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shot. Great background. Congrats on your win.

Photo of the Day for February 29, 2004 -- Pfauenauge urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Comments: A peacock feather with all but blue desaturated and blue saturation increased Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: Nice shot and well executedpost processing.

Photo of the Day for March 13, 2004 -- Skylight urlLink Photographer: E. Kitson Southward Comments: While shopping for accessories for my camera in Las Vegas, I took this picture of a skylight in the center of the Mall. ISO was set at 400 because I was shooting with available light within the Mall. Aperture priority f 8 @ 1/640 Camera used: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ10 Geo. location: Las Vegas, Nevada Judge's comments: Very nice image, had to look twice to see what I was looking at. Nice detail. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for March 12, 2004 -- His Firstborn Son urlLink Photographer: Julia Mazza Comments: A shot of my brother-in-law with his newborn son. Struck by lightning at age 13, no one ever thought he would be able to live a normal life, but he proved them wrong. It has been nice to see his dreams come true. Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: Clearwater, FL Judge's comments: Lovely image and even more special after having read your comments. I bet they were happy with your shot.

Photo of the Day for March 11, 2004 -- Balancing Act urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Comments: At first I tried to position the camera to get full separation between Woody and his shadow but then I realized he was probably holding on for support to be able to balance on my wobbly table :) Image was slightly cropped, toned, auto-processed, clarify applied (this gives it that hint of a halo around Woody and his shadow), then resized and USM applied. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: Lovely executed shot with the shadow touching Woody. I really like the idea. It almost seems as if the shadow runs away! Maybe a very small tilt so that the line of the table is straight? It is not disturbing at all, I just noticed. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for March 10, 2004 -- Iris urlLink Photographer: Blake Heminger Comments: A purple/blue iris grown in my garden in California Camera used: Nikon CP5700 Geo. location: Foster City CA Judge's comments: Very nice and soft image.

Photo of the Day for March 9, 2004 -- Great Blue urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: A Great Blue Heron in flight. Photo taken March 7, 2004 near Mayport, Florida with my Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the d30 Camera used: Canon EOS d30 Geo. location: Mayport, Florida Judge's comments: Excellent bird image. Congratulations Jim.

Photo of the Day for March 8, 2004 -- Trapped urlLink Photographer: Robert Wingard Comments: Used photoshop 7 and several photos to create this final shot. Camera used: Sony DSC-858 Geo. location: Kensoah, Wisconsin Judge's comments: Very nice idea and well exectued. Congrats with this winning picture, it gave me a laugh although I would have liked it even better if and when the man was in the glass ofcourse (grin)

Photo of the Day for March 7, 2004 -- Fluid Motion urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: It is amazing to watch as they fly and just seem to hang in mid air. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Judge's comments: What a lovely shot. Congratulations with this catch.

Photo of the Day for March 20, 2004 -- Winter Morning urlLink Photographer: Ron Case Comments: I took this photo early one cold January Sunday morning. The temperature was minus 7 degrees (F). I took about 30 pictures that morning and by the time I was done my hands were about frozen! The only post processing done on it was a slight crop on the left hand side. Camera used: Kodak DC3400 Geo. location: Wellsville UT Judge's comments: Lovely shot Ron. I like the fence, that really takes your eye right into the image. Congratulations.

Photo of the Day for March 19, 2004 -- "Apricot Delight" urlLink Photographer: Blake Heminger Comments: A rose called "Apricot Delight" Camera used: Nikon CP5700 Geo. location: Foster City, CA Judge's comments: Lovely rose again Blake. Like the softness and color a lot!

Photo of the Day for March 18, 2004 -- LoverBoy urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: This fellow was working hard to please one of the nesting females at the Alligator Farm today. I watched him make several trips to the nest with assorted sizes of material...this was one of his smaller loads, but it seemed to be fairly heavy. Photo taken March 17, 2004 in St. Augustine, Florida with my Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the d30. Camera used: Canon EOS d30 Geo. location: St. Augustine, Florida Judge's comments: Ehm well. what can I say/ I really love the detail and action of this shot. I wonder when we will see the littl'uns. And ehm... Jim? Do you sleep there as well?

Photo of the Day for March 17, 2004 -- Eye of the Eagle urlLink Photographer: Bobbi Hedman Comments: A portrait of an eagle Camera used: Canon Digital Rebel Geo. location: Wabasha, MN Judge's comments: Lovely bird portrait! Congrats.

Photo of the Day for March 16, 2004 -- Skinned urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: This lizard is loosing it's skin, can spring be far behind? Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas Judge's comments: Strange..... look at that skin :-) Well you talk about spring, but I don't know about that.... Lovely shot and educational as well :-)

Photo of the Day for March 15, 2004 -- Closed for the season urlLink Photographer: Bobbi Hedman Comments: My birdfeeder after a recent snow fall. Camera used: Canon Digital Rebel Geo. location: St. Paul, MN Judge's comments: I bet you have to enlarge this one before you can see what you are actually looking at. Nice white snow, I see blueish snow quite often. Nice shot, but I really think you would do the birds a favor if you would open up again!

Photo of the Day for March, 14, 2004 -- Red Yellow Tulips urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Went to the flower show this past week and purchase some potted flowers. No place to put them...just wanted to take the pictures. I'll give them to an associate at work to plant at his home. (f/ 9, 1/3 sec., EB +1/3, ISO-160, tripod mounted, studio lighting, 10:34PM) Camera used: Fuji FP S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Lovely shot and.. I know.. it is a flower again.... but nevertheless a very nice image.

Photo of the Day for March 27, 2004 -- Top of the World urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: This mighty dragon seems to be at the top of his world. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Texas Judge's comments: Lovely macro of this dragon fly!

Photo of the Day for March 26, 2004 -- A Full Load urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: This fellow is trying to get the job done in one trip....leaving more time for fun with the little woman, I suppose. :^) Frankly, I doubt that she'll go for this idea, and he'll be heading back out for some more managable pieces in no time. Photo taken March 23, 2004 using my Canon EOS 10d, which was beautifully repaired by the nice folks at the Canon Service Center in New Jersey! Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: St. Augustine, Florida Judge's comments: Great to read that your camera is in working order again. And what a lovely shot again. Poor thing has a busy job! But Jim, I really can't stop thinking about you, taking your shots... I imagine you sitting on a small chair waiting for these birds to fly by you! Is that true? Anyway, great shot. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for March 25, 2004 -- Gazebo in the Park at Sunset urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: f/ 2.8, 1/400 sec., ISO-200, handheld, 05:29 PM, Philadelphia, PA. Took this yesterday on the way home from a concert we sang in. The entire image was processed normally. I selected the gazebo and made layer of the copy and reprocessed it. A background layer was made and the Hayes Island painting effect action was applied and all the layers merged. Made adjustements to the saturation and then changed the color blue in the sky a bit with color replacement. Processed in PS elements. Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Lovely shot and lovely post processing on this one! You need to click to see the larger version, there is quite a lot to be seen.

Photo of the Day for March 24, 2004 -- Busy Day at the M&M Factory urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Comments: I love M&Ms! :) Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: Lovely image, it gave me a laugh!

Photo of the Day for March 23, 2004 -- Backyard Bigmouth urlLink Photographer: Lyn Winans Comments: Camera used: Olympus E-1 Geo. location: Minden Judge's comments: Indeed a big mouth! Lovely image of a lovely creature.

Photo of the Day for March 22, 2004 -- Chimneys urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Comments: Just a bunch of chimneys on top of a roof that attracted my attention ... Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: I can imagine that this attracted your attention. Lovely image, the line combined with the chimneys. Simple and clear.

Photo of the Day for March 21, 2004 -- I Love You urlLink Photographer: Robert Wingard Comments: A language that crosses all barriers. Camera used: DSC-828 Geo. location: Kenosha, WI Judge's comments: Yes, we can all do with that. A simple signing that can be heard by everyone. Lovely image.

Photo of the Day for April 3, 2004 -- Delicate Folds urlLink Photographer: Terry Cervi Comments: Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: Kenmore, NY Judge's comments: Lovely Lily shot with lovely softness.

Photo of the Day for April 2, 2004 -- Abstract in Oil urlLink Photographer: Lyn Winans Comments: - Camera used: Olympus E-1 Geo. location: Minden, ON Judge's comments: Well seen and good colors. Was it the sun shining on an oil stain on the street?

Photo of the Day for April 1, 2004 -- Coronaria urlLink Photographer: Blake Heminger Comments: This is a poppy-flowered anemone called "Coronaria" Camera used: Nikon CP5700 Geo. location: Foster City, CA Judge's comments: Lovely soft colors. I like this image a lot. Would have liked a larger image though :-)

Photo of the Day for March 31, 2004 -- Swirl urlLink Photographer: Julia Mazza Comments: Shot in Orlando FL under the Sorcerers Hat at MGM studios. I spotted this swirling design and couldn't resist capturing it. Shot over Spring Break last week while touring the Disney theme parks. Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shot, good detail and colors!

Photo of the Day for March 30, 2004 -- Walk in the Shadows urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Comments: Every time we have Tango class I'm eyeing the shadow on the floor. Last week I finally brought in my camera and got my husband to walk across it. I love how there's this little outline of light on the side of his leg. Camera used: Pentax 555 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: Lovely shot, really something to look at twice!

Photo of the Day for March 29, 2004 -- Misty urlLink Photographer: Bobbi Hedman Comments: I was just driving around and saw this horse grazing and surrounded in ground fog Camera used: Canon Digital Rebel Geo. location: Knapp, WI Judge's comments: What a lovely scene, so quiet! Congrats on this lovely image.

Photo of the Day for March 28, 2004 -- Duty and Honor urlLink Photographer: Robert Wingard Comments: tribute to the men and woman in the armed forces. As an ex-vet I understand the sacrifice these men and woman make. No matter what they deserve our support. Camera used: Camera: DSC-858 Geo. location: Kenosha, WI. Judge's comments: Nice image and a good composition. Congratulations.

Photo of the Day for April 10, 2004 -- Watching the Dog urlLink Photographer: Terry Cervi Comments: Camera used: Nikon CP990 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Well... I will think of some comments myself.. I can imagine this doggy sitting in the kitchen and waiting for soemthing to eat. 'Well.. that chocolate rabbit would do' :-) Anyway... the shot is nice but .... never give a dog chocolate, since it will cause heart problems and can cause detah very very rapidly in dogs!

Photo of the Day for April 9, 2004 -- urlLink Photographer: Bonnie Lackey Comments: The name of this hosta is Love Pat - it is a delightfully small hosta that thrives in the shade. I enhanced the color and call it Hosta Palettes. Camera used: Nikon Coolpix 5000 Geo. location: Sleepy Hollow, IL. Judge's comments: Lovely image. You should click for the larger version. Congratulations.
Photo of the Day for April 8, 2004 -- Dune Side urlLink Photographer: Sherry March Comments: Camera used: Nikon Coolpix 995 Geo. location: Wellsville, PA Judge's comments: Lovely shot, nice angle.
Photo of the Day for April 7, 2004 -- artist urlLink Photographer: Louis Hartman Comments: Camera used: canon 300 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shot. Congratulations.

Photo of the Day for April 6, 2004 -- None the Wiser urlLink Photographer: Donna Pellegrin Comments: I was going for a full face, wide-eyed view, but its head turned so quickly I missed. However, I was happy with this shot after all. Camera used: Pentax Optio 555 Geo. location: Audubon Zoo in New Orleans, La Judge's comments: Nice clear shot of a lovely creature.

Photo of the Day for April 5, 2004 -- Jewels of the Sea urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Comments: Pieces of broken glass, polished by the sea. I collected those on a walk on the beach last New Year's Eve. Positioned on a lightbox for the photo. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: Lovely shot, great idea and well executed with the lightbox.

Photo of the Day for April 4, 2004 -- Spring on Van Pelt Street urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Did I ever tell you that Van Pelt Street is lined with Lingham Cherry Trees in Spring? Guess I forgot. Well it is and it accentuates the street rather nicely, I think. Shame the blossom last to short a time but I was fortunate enough to get it this past week. The sky was buildings in the distance that seem to crowd the little street in, so it was replaced. I removed an air conditioner from one of the windows as well. The entire image was processed normally and then given a slight buzz simplifier no. 1. Camera used: Fuji Fine Pix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Lovely shot, with nice colors. I bet the original was good as well, but the post processing makes it almost a painting.

Photo of the Day for April 17, 2004 -- Surreal Flight urlLink Photographer: Terry Cervi Comments: Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely image. Don't really know what you did here.. maybe you can help us out in the forum!

Photo of the Day for April 16, 2004 -- Red ball at rest urlLink Photographer: Margaret Satchell Comments: Camera used: Nikon D70 Geo. location: Carl Schurz park, New York City Judge's comments: Very nice image. The red against the black and white is very attractive.

Photo of the Day for April 15, 2004 -- Window Trimmings urlLink Photographer: Blake Heminger Comments: A combination of window blinds, white curtains, sunlight and shadows. Camera used: Nikon CP5700 Geo. location: Foster City,CA Judge's comments: Well seen and lovely detail!

Photo of the Day for April 14, 2004 -- Demolition Site urlLink Photographer: Gerda Grice Comments: This site was already partly demolished when I came across it the other day. I thought that the torn poster and the partly graffiti covered, boarded up and broken up old building looked very interesting together, so I took this picture. Aperture priority; ISO 100; f/5.0; ss 1/80. Haze filter only. Camera used: Minolta DiMage A1 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Nice shot and the contrast between the poster and the rest of the image is really attractive. Well seen!

Photo of the Day for April 13, 2004 -- Express Colors urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Store window display. Liked the lighting and the colors. (f/ 3.6, 1/32 sec., EB +1/3, ISO-200, handheld, shot at night through glass, 08:45pm) Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Lovely colorful picture and it made me smile. Imagine washing these all together :-)

Photo of the Day for April 12,2004 -- Day & Night urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Comments: Black and white construction paper used for the background. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: Lovely idea and well executed!

Photo of the Day for April 11, 2004 -- Happy Easter urlLink Photographer: Julia Mazza Comments: Wishes for a very blessed holiday! Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: Clearwater, FL Judge's comments: I wish you also a happy Easter....

Photo of the Day for April 24, 2004 -- Partials urlLink Photographer: Franziska Lang Comments: Trying for a different angle with flowers. Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Virginia Judge's comments: Lovely shot with great angle! Good idea and well executed!

Photo of the Day for April 23, 2004 -- A Perfect Pose urlLink Photographer: Terry Cervi Comments: This was taken in my back yard last summer. I'm not sure which butterfly this is however. Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shot.. Makes me long for summer as well! I love the detail, color and composition.

Photo of the Day for April 22, 2004 -- Spring Is Here urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: A covered bridge in North Georgia Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Georgia Judge's comments: Lovely shot, looks like it is a beautiful scenery there!

Photo of the Day for April 21, 2004 -- Mats urlLink Photographer: Gerda Grice Comments: I took this one while I was out walking today. I happened to see these mats lined up in a box on the sidewalk outside a little store, and I just loved the colours and textures. So, I stopped and snapped a couple of shots of them, and I was really pleased that this photo turned out as well as it did. Aperture priority; ISO 100; f/5.0; ss 1/60. Hand held. Camera used: Minolta DiMage A1 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely image and well spotted! You were lucky to carry your camera around..... so, let that be a lesson for all of us! Carry a camera along all the time, you never know!

Photo of the Day for April 20, 2004 -- Gentle Giant urlLink Photographer: Brandon M. Pittam Comments: This picture is of M'geni Mopaya, a 400+ pound silverback. The title says it all, because he will make eye contact with some guests and he will sometimes sit by the glass. Great creature for taking many pictures of. Camera used: Canon EOS 10D (w. 400mm f5.6 Lens) Geo. location: National Zoo in Washington DC Judge's comments: Lovely image with great detail of this huge animal.

Photo of the Day for April 19, 2004 -- Boat Winch urlLink Photographer: Gary J. Will Comments: Sailboat winch and sheet Camera used: Nikon 5700 Geo. location: Bellingham, WA Judge's comments: Lovely shot, nice angle and great detail.

Photo of the Day for April 18, 2004 -- Whirlpool, Shadow, Brick urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: I shot this for the Orange Challenge on another site. Didn't enter it. Like what I entered better at the time. Second looks make me like this a bit more. (f/ 4.0, 1/125 sec., ISO-160, handheld, 01:48 PM) Camera used: Fuji FinePix S602Z Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Very nice image with a lot of contrast. I like the lines of the shadow. It is not 'just' a shadow but really adds to the picture.

Photo of the Day for May 1, 2004 -- Walking the tight wire urlLink Photographer: Margaret Schmidt Comments: These guys were really hard to get into focus, they were no bigger then a grain of pepper, at first I thought it was saw dust and after I got a look at them YUK.... Camera used: Canon 10D Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shot, you really need to click it to see the larger version. Congrats.

Photo of the Day for April 30, 2004 -- Tea and Golden Silhouettes urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: Store window display. Shot at night through glass. (f/ 4.5, 1/500 sec., ISO-200, aperture priority, macro mode, hand held, 09:37 PM) Camera used: Olympus C750UZ Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Lovely shot and if you did not tell us that it was a window display I would have thought that you made a lovely composition yourself for this shot! Congrats, I like the colors a lot.

Photo of the Day for April 29, 2004 -- Bright-Eyed & Bushy-Tailed urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: I like the "expression" on this fellow's face as he flies by on his way back to the nest. Photo taken April 21, 2004 with my Canon 100-400mm lens attached to the 10d. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: St. Augustine, Florida Judge's comments: Lovely image again Jim. I have to smile when I imagine you sitting there and wait until one of the birds will fly by you. Great shot. Congrats!

Photo of the Day for April 28, 2004 -- Nemesis urlLink Photographer: Fax Sinclair (KonaFairy) Comments: While standing in a cloud of mosquitoes trying to get a good shot of the torch gingers I saw this one taking a rest. The photographer's nemesis! Camera used: Nikon Coolpix 8700. Macro mode. Morning light Geo. location: Taken in "The Mosquito Dell" Honaunau, Hawaii Judge's comments: Lovely and clear shot of this creepy creature. Hope you smashed it after taking the shot :-) Congratulations on your win.

Congratulations to Robert Wingard , a Premium Member, for winning the Photo of the Month for March. He will receive a $50 gift credit from urlLink iPads.com (our sponsor) as a prize. Just another benefit of being a member! We will announce the monthly winner for April (along with the prize) in May.

Photo of the Day for April 27, 2004 -- Come On, Mom ! urlLink Photographer: Lyn Winans Comments: Camera used: Olympus E-1 Geo. location: Minden, ON Judge's comments: I can imagine this doggy sitting in the car... waiting and looking at all the things that pass by him. It made me smile.

Photo of the Day for April 26, 2004 -- What a Rough Day! urlLink Photographer: Julia Mazza Comments: This is my good friend's little guy--3 months old, shortly after his baptism. I don't think he was having a very good day, but I loved this shot. Camera used: Sony DSC F707 Geo. location: Clearwater, FL Judge's comments: Poor kid :-) Lovely shot, I like the expression a lot!

Photo of the Day for April 25, 2004 -- Frog or Prince?? urlLink Photographer: Joyce Sherwin Comments: Prince is my daughter's pet frog Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: At home - Alberta, Canada Judge's comments: Lovely shot, it made me smile when I looked at his expression.

Photo of the Day for May 8, 2004 -- Protest urlLink Photographer: Margaret Satchell Comments: Camera used: Nikon D70 Geo. location: Washington, DC, Taken on April 25, 2004 Judge's comments: This is such a lucky shot! Well seen and captured. You really should click the small image to see the larger image. Image with high impact.

Photo of the Day for May 7, 2004 -- Darning Needle urlLink Photographer: Fax Sinclair Comments: A damselfly. Megalagrion leptodemas on water cabbage Camera used: Nikon Coolpix 8700. Hand-held. Natural light. Geo. location: Honaunau, Hawaii Judge's comments: Lovely shot! Nice colors.

Photo of the Day for May 6, 2004 -- 18th Street North urlLink Photographer: Robert Mann Comments: I wanted to take a shot that has both the Arch Street Presbyterian Church and the Cathedral of Sts. Peter and Paul in it.....they both have great domes and the only possbile shot is lacking of one or the other. I did manage to take this one that shows the front facades of each up 18th St. The cathedral is the further of the two. I also like this one because of the many architectural styles running through the image. In the original image a power line was running along the fronts of all the buildings up to the catherdral...it and the several street lights from which it was hung were removed from the final image. ( f/ 6.3, 1/400 sec., ISO-50, aperture priority, 04:52 PM) Camera used: Olympus C750UZ Geo. location: Philadelphia, PA Judge's comments: Well seen. A lovely shot and giving us a good idea of your surroundings with all the different styles!

Photo of the Day for May 5, 2004 -- Eye of the Albino urlLink Photographer: Jim Carper Comments: Yes, there actually are alligators at the Alligator Farm.....they are all around you the whole time you are there, as a matter of fact. This is a close up shot of one of two albino alligators on display. Because of their sensitivity to the sunlight, these fellows are kept in their own separate covered enclosures. Camera used: Canon EOS 10d Geo. location: St. Augustine, Florida Judge's comments: Lovely shot, but I would not like to meet this one! Nice shot Jim.

Photo of the Day for May 4, 2004 -- 9.5 Landing urlLink Photographer: Bob Hall Comments: Caught this Brown Pelican just comming in. The frame makes it look like the other 2 are watching him Camera used: Nikon D100 Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely image Bob. And you are right, the other pelicans are watching him.... maybe giving him notes for the dive... or envy him for catching some fish. We wil never know, we can only enjoy your shot.

Photo of the Day for May 3, 2004 -- Angel Wings urlLink Photographer: Blake Heminger Comments: A rose called "Angel Wings" Camera used: Nikon CP5700 Geo. location: Foster City, Ca Judge's comments: Lovely deail and DOF on this one. I really like the softness of the rose.

Photo of the Day for May 2, 2004 -- Love Seeds! urlLink Photographer: Terry Cervi Comments: Camera used: Canon EOS 10D Geo. location: Judge's comments: Lovely shot with great detail of the bird an the seed.

Photo of the Day for May 15, 2004 -- American Goldfinch urlLink Photographer: Gary J. Will Comments: This was taken in my back yard. We have many feeders and attract a broad variety of birds, but these little guys are high on my list of favorites. Camera used: Canon 10D Geo. location: Keizer, OR Judge's comments: What a lovely image of a great bird. We don't see these around here. I bet you were happy to catch this little guy.
